title: 100 Cities Project: Fighting Loneliness | Dinner with Strangers (68)
summary: City life can be lonely, especially when youâ€™re surrounded by so many people. Take the opportunity to meet others hoping for new connections
venue: Arbor, H Queen's #25/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Hey, Hong Kong! When was the last time you did something completely spontaneous? Our series groups together complete strangers for a fun day out. That's right, you sign up, and we book the restaurant. We know life can get busy. Don't forget to spend time making new friends! Don't do city life alone and build your community with us. This project is to host dinners in 100 major cities to combat loneliness while supporting locally owned businesses. We are dedicating 25% of sales towards charity or GoFundMe pages at the end of each month. How does it work? -After you register, you'll be emailed an introduction message including a quick questionnaire regarding age, dietary restrictions, hobbies, and interests that we use to select restaurants for the night's group. -At the end of the month, we'll share sales reports with attendees and detail how we are utilizing 25% of sales towards social good. *Your registration does not include your individual food and drink purchases. *These outings are intended to help people make friends. These are not singles gatherings. Our vision is simple: we take the no gimmicks approach to networking. No need for yet another app to take up space on your phone - just four walls and a roof and good food for people to connect :) We coordinate with you directly, human-to-human. If you have any more questions, please contact ermantourageimpact@gmail.com! Brought to you by event series Ermantourage. You can also take a look at our main event calendar via Posh for coffee meets, evening hangouts, and more!

title: 100-Point Champagne Dinner
summary: Join us for an unforgettable evening dedicated to the pinnacle of Champagne, hosted by JamesSuckling.com Critic, Claire Nesbitt.
organizer: JamesSuckling.com, website of acclaimed international wine critic James Suckling
venue: James Suckling Wine Central, 22 Staunton Street #2nd floor, Hong Kong, 00000, Hong Kong, Hong Kong
description: Join us for an unforgettable evening dedicated to the pinnacle of Champagne, hosted by JamesSuckling.com Staff Writer & Critic, Claire Nesbitt. She covers Champagne annually with James, and this exclusive dinner celebrates a selection of the region's iconic houses, culminating in a tasting of two perfect 100-point wines. From the purity of non-vintage Bruts to the mastery of multi-vintage blends and the prestige of legendary cuvÃ©es, this is a rare opportunity to explore the elegance, emotion, and precision that define the world's greatest sparkling wine. Claire will guide you through each flight, sharing insights from her tastings and reports on the Champagne region. title: 2025 Hong Kong Law Fair
summary: Join us at the 2025 Hong Kong Law Fair for a day filled with legal insights, networking opportunities, and career guidance!
venue: Hall 5G, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre, 1  Expo Drive, Wan Chai, HKI, Hong Kong, Wan Chai, HKI
description: Welcome to the 2025 Hong Kong Law Fair! Meet over 50 leading law firms, professional legal organisations and law schools in Hong Kong - all gathered under one roof to offer you insights, guidance, and opportunities to connect with the legal profession. This is your chance to ask questions, explore career paths, and build networks that matter. Free admission is offered to penultimate LLB, double law degree and JD students. Law students from other years are also welcome to register for free admission, but is subject to availability. Non-law and LLM students are welcome to attend with a registration fee of HKD 500, and admission is subject to a quota. Registration is required to attend, and successful registrants will receive a QR code before the event. We look forward to seeing you at Hall 5G, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre! *In the event of adverse weather conditions (e.g. T8 or above, or a Black Rainstorm Signal), the Law Fair Committee will consider rescheduling the event to Sunday, 7 September 2025, subject to venue availability. Further details will be announced if this occurs.

title: Advanced Contract Law for Non-Lawyers Masterclass Hongkong
summary: REGISTER TODAY! Email: register@crownleadership.com | WhatsApp at: +61 4 8593 1500
venue: Regal Hongkong Hotel, 88 Yee Wo Street, China, NT, Hong Kong, China, NT
description: An advanced version of Contract Law for Non Legal Professionals, this course addresses the most recent and more complex contract law issues faced by executives by Examining advanced elements of contract law and contractual obligations to manage risk, systematically audit contracts and improve dispute resolution methods You will examine the issues in contracts â€“ from conception to completion - manage risks, deal with disputes, damages, and termination in the event of a breach or disagreement. This advanced course will highlight on how judges deal with issues of interpretation of contracts and how and what you must do to ensure that ambiguity is avoided in documentation. You will also be taken through case studies on interpretations of recent decisions of judges and the impact of these decisions on contract law and its practice.

title: AI Applications in Digital Marketing Hongkong
summary: REGISTER TODAY! Email: register@crownleadership.com | WhatsApp at: +61 4 8593 1500
venue: Regal Hongkong Hotel, 88 Yee Wo Street, China, NT, Hong Kong, China, NT
description: In the rapidly evolving digital landscape, Artificial Intelligence (AI) is reshaping the way marketers approach their strategies, campaigns, and customer engagement. The "AI Applications in Digital Marketing" course offers a comprehensive exploration of how AI is transforming marketing practices and empowering professionals to work smarter, not harder. Participants will gain practical insights into the core AI tools that are influencing the marketing domainâ€”from customer journey mapping and predictive analytics to content personalization and performance optimization. This course will demystify AI terminology, highlight real-world applications, and provide guidance on integrating AI into existing marketing workflows. Designed to be hands-on and outcomes-driven, the course encourages strategic thinking while equipping participants with the ability to critically evaluate AI solutions. With a focus on both current capabilities and future trends, attendees will leave with the confidence to lead AI-powered marketing initiatives within their organizations.

title: Anti-Loneliness Club | Dinner with Strangers: Hong Kong
summary: Join us for a fun night out with new friends in Hong Kong. Build your community in the city through our socials and make connections!
venue: Restaurant of the Week, 5 Connaught Road Central #25/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: When was the last time you did something completely spontaneous? Our series groups together complete strangers for a fun night out. That's right, you sign up, and we book the restaurant. We know life can get busy. Don't forget to spend time making new friends! Why do city life alone when you can build your community with us. Embrace the awkwardness of meeting new people for the first time blindly: all ages, interests, hobbies, and backgrounds. This project is to host dinners in 100 cities to combat loneliness in the modern world while supporting locally owned businesses. Each month, dinner is held at a different restaurant. These dinners are not directly associated with the restaurants, but are simply based on a table reservation. This micro-event is intended to be for 4-6 people maximum. If the evening you signed up for does not hit the minimum number of signups, please be open to joining us on another night with a fuller group. Check out our feature in Eventbrite's 2025 TRNDS report about embracing the micro-event trend. How does it work? After you register, you'll be emailed an introduction message. We'll stay in touch with you leading up to the night of the dinner. Expect a Final Details email the day of. *Your registration does not include your individual food and drink purchases. A paid ticket simply makes you more committed to actually showing up. *Sign up one time, and you'll join our database to be invited to all dinners. *These outings are intended to help people make friends. These are not singles gatherings. *If you sign up the day of the gathering and do not get a welcoming message from us in time, simply email ermantourageimpact@gmail.com, request a refund, or please be open to joining us on another evening. Our vision is simple: we take the no gimmicks approach to networking. No need for yet another app to take up space on your phone - just four walls and a roof and good food for people to connect :) We coordinate with you directly, human-to-human. If you have any more questions, please contact ermantourageimpact@gmail.com! Brought to you by event series Ermantourage. You can also take a look at our main event calendar via Posh for coffee meets, evening hangouts, and more!

title: Freedom Fridays
summary: Join Ali Abdaal for Freedom Fridays: live life on your own terms through financial and time freedom. Interactive talk + Q&A.
venue: the Hive Sheung Wan, 35 Hillier Street #33, Sheung Wan, HKI, Hong Kong, Sheung Wan, HKI
description: Join Ali for an exclusive Freedom Fridays session where we'll tackle the real question: how can you live life on your own terms through achieving time and financial freedom? This isn't about quitting your job tomorrow. It's about building options so you can actually live life on your own terms. What we'll cover depends on what you ask, but might include: You're doing well on paper but something's off. Maybe you're missing family stuff because of work, or you want flexibility but can't afford the pay cut, or you just know there's got to be a better way than grinding until retirement. Come with your questions. Whether it's about starting a side business, transitioning careers, or just figuring out what you actually want - we'll work through it together. Ready to build some options? Bring your questions about time freedom, financial freedom, and living life on your own terms. Let's figure this out. "Half the doctors I asked said they'd quit tomorrow if they won the lottery. The other half said they'd work part-time. That's when I realized I was heading toward the same trap - and decided to build my way out." Space is limited to ensure an intimate, high-value experience.

title: Reviving Hong Kong's Ocean Heritage â€“ Our Forgotten Oyster Reefs
summary: "Our Forgotten Oyster Reefs" highlights the ecological and cultural importance of oyster reefs and showcases local restoration efforts.

description: Oyster reefs â€” once thriving along Hong Kongâ€™s coastlines â€“ are now nearly lost. These remarkable ecosystems are vital for healthy oceans, thriving fisheries, coastal resilience, and are deeply rooted in local culture. Today, however, oyster reefs are among the most endangered marine habitats in the world and there is an urgent need to restore them.Through illustrated displays, the exhibition "Reviving Hong Kong's Ocean Heritage â€“ Our Forgotten Oyster Reefs" highlights the ecological and cultural importance of oyster reefs and showcases local restoration efforts. It also showcases how local conservation teams use scientific methods to restore oyster reefs and rebuild a healthy marine ecosystem. The exhibition also features a screening of the documentary â€œCity of Shellsâ€, which delves into the ecological value of oyster reefs and the restoration efforts being undertaken in Hong Kong. ExhibitionDate: July 16 - August 30, 2025Venue: exhibition venue, 3/F, eslite spectrum Tsim Sha Tsui Store

title: Traditional Chinese Walled Village + 300 years old Temple
summary: Most of the tourists visited Hong Kong Island and Kowloon but rarely visit New Territories.
venue: å¤§åœç«™, Tai Wai MTR Station, Hong Kong, NT, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, NT
description: Most of the tourists visit Hong Kong Island and Kowloon but rarely visit New Territories. People asked me where are the buildings over 300 years old. The British colonial period started in 1841 (only 182 years ago). What did Hong Kong look like in the pre-colonial period? In this tour, I will take you to the ancestral hall of the traditional Chinese House. I will also show you the tradition of worshipping god in a temple. 1. Traditional Walled Village - Tsang Tai UkOne of Hong Kongâ€™s best-preserved walled villages. You can still see the original granite, bricks and timber used to build the village. Guard towers were built on each of the four corners to protect against pirates, who ran rampant in Hong Kong until the early 20th century. This is still a living village. 2. Sha Tin Che Kung TempleThis is a temple of 300 years old. Was built before the colonial period. You will learn about the traditional culture 3. The Old House at Wong Uk Village Wong Uk Village was founded during the reign of Qianlong (1736-1795) in the Qing dynasty by the Wong clan from Xingning county in Guangdong. In the 19th century, the village became a major trading station for travellers and traders plying the route between Guangdong and Kowloon and prospered until the late 19th century. I will show you how to appreciate the fine mural paintings and traditional decorations on the traditional house. 4.High Rock Centre It was old police barracks of Shatin and also the place for orphans. The main building was a large, two-storey brick and wood building. 5 ,6,7..... and more places in the tours. By the end of the tour, you will have more understanding of the traditional side of Hong Kong Meeting Point: We will meet at Tai Wai Station Exit B. In front of DHL express.Tai Wai Station is on East Rail Line of the MTR. The tips for the tour will be collected at the beginning of the tour, HK$300 per person. More than 3 people will be offered a discount. If you want to have a one-person tour, HK$500. I guarantee it is worth the cost.

title: Work in Europe / Sweden - Jobs, Employers, Work Visa (HK)
summary: Get help with applying for your Swedish work visa, meeting employers and applying for jobs.
venue: Hong Kong WeWork, 1è™Ÿ Shing Cheong Road, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: ABOUT THIS WORKSHOP: Our workshop is specially designed to give international job seekers in Sweden an insight into what is required by Swedish employers and how to improve their chances of success. All workshops are held as 1 on 1 sessions via online web meetings over Skype. Typical duration is 45 mins. WORKSHOP CONTENTS: This is your chance to work directly with a recruiter and get help with moving to Sweden, finding a job and settling down. You will learn how to apply for jobs in Sweden and getting your work permit / visa. Learn about applying for jobs: 1. How to match your skills and experience with Swedish companies hiring 2. Which industries you should focus on and how to find out about jobs available ? How to find opportunities at companies such as Spotify, Truecaller, Tictail that are rapidly expanding into international markets. 3. How to connect with employers hiring international talent and who to contact 4. How to present your skills and competencies. 5. How to apply at the right time depending on the industry and company. 6. How to send your CV and follow up 7. How to get decisions and interview requests. 8. Your expected salary and salary negotiations Learn about getting your work permit: 1. How the work permit application process works 2. How to meet employer and migration board requirements. 3. How to qualify for fast track work permit application 4. How to secure your work permit, tax id number (personal number) 5. What you need to know before you arrive in Sweden - housing, food, expense budgets, bank account, settling in 6. Your rights as an international job seeker, insurance, trade union rules 7. How to secure a permanent work residence permit 8. Common mistakes international job seekers make and how to to avoid application errors

title: 100-hours Inversion Teacher Training Certificate Course
summary: Monday, Wednesday & Friday Morning, 9:30 am-12:30 pm, 01st September 2025 ~ 26th September 2025
organizer: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the heart
venue: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Anahata Yoga is a premier yoga centre based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga. As a centre, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle. About Anahata Yoga Accredited â€œ100hrs Inverse Yoga Teacher Training Courseâ€ Anahata Yogaâ€™s accredited Inversion Yoga Teacher Training is designed with the developmental needs of our students at the centre â€“ learning to understand the physical and mental challenges of the inversion poses and how to appropriately teach these poses safely is fundamental to a yoga teacherâ€™s skill set. The core of our teacher training program is to provide our students with the knowledge and skill to enable them to then teach inversion poses with awareness for the unique anatomy and physiology needs of their students. Also, to skill them with a wide variety of methods and tools to tailor their teaching appropriately and with confidence. Our faculty of teachers who are teaching this inversion teacher training are from the andiappan yoga tradition. They have embedded yoga into their daily lifestyle and understand the importance of teaching the foundation yogic practices in a manner that enables the students to build a strong foundation for a lifelong yoga journey. All of our teachers have substantial experience as yoga teachers and in teaching inversion and inversion-themed classes, workshops, private classes â€“ they all have extensive experience in transforming studentsâ€™ practices and capabilities, to levels where the students can practice basic to advanced postures with confidence and in a safe manner without fear for risk of injury.

title: 100-hours Kids Yoga Teacher Training (Saturday Morning and Afternoon)
summary: 100-hours Kids Yoga Teacher Training (Saturday Morning and Afternoon) 01st November 2025 - 06th December 2025
organizer: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the heart
description: Anahata Yoga is a premier yoga centre based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga. As a centre, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle. Starting a yoga practice at a young age creates a healthy life for youngsters. By nature, childrenâ€™s minds and bodies are flexible, adaptable and easily teachable. So long as yoga is fun, creative and interactive, itâ€™s an activity theyâ€™re sure to like. In addition to being a great physical activity, yoga offers an entertaining way for children to learn about the mind and body, and their functions and abilities. Children also learn to balance their emotions and improve their focus and concentration through yoga. Various studies have shown that children who regularly practice yoga have better health and emotional balance, and are less likely to be afflicted with common health issues such as allergies, asthma, digestive disorders, obesity, ADD and ADHD. At Anahata Yoga, parents who enjoy yoga also pave the way for their children to enjoy the activity, making yoga a regular family activity and cultivating a healthy lifestyle. And just as yoga can be tailored according to the needs and capacities of every individual, so can kidsâ€™ yoga be designed to match the interests of every individual child â€“ not only ensuring a healthy body and mind, but also some fun and laughter along the way. Anahata Yogaâ€™s Kidsâ€™ Yoga Teacher Training Course (100 hours) is one of the first accredited Certification Programme for Kidâ€™s yoga in Hong Kong. Anahata Yoga offers a solid foundational grounding of yoga instruction and mindful yoga practices for children. Students learn the physiology and psychology of children of various age groups, and how to incorporate yoga to their leisure time as a hobby, a sport, and a discipline in a fun and creative way. â€œIt takes a big heart to shape little minds,â€ it is said. At Anahata Yoga, students learn to teach kidsâ€™ yoga from the heart. At the end of our programme, students will be able to confidently teach yoga to children and design creative yoga classes for children of various age groups. For further details, please click the link below: https://anahatayoga.com.hk/training_workshop/100-hours-kids-yoga-teacher-training-saturday-morning-and-afternoon-2/

title: 100-hours Pranayama and Meditation Teacher Training Course
summary: Breaks - 29 October 2025. Class Schedule: Monday & Wednesday (6:30 pm - 9:30 pm)
organizer: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the heart
venue: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Anahata Yoga is a premiere yoga centre based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga. As a centre, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle. Anahata Yoga's 100 Hours Pranayama & Meditation Teacher Training Certificate Course gives yoga practitioners, enthusiasts, and aspiring instructors the chance to learn the art of mindfulness and mindful living. Through the course, students gain a better understanding of the basics of breathing, concentration and meditation techniques and how it influences the body and mind. We recognize that yoga is a popular pursuit in Hong Kong. People seek it out for its health benefits and often incorporate it into their active lifestyles. However, yoga instruction is not equal among the various yoga centers in Hong Kong. This is where our accredited Teacher Training Courses make all the difference. Our courses are accredited by and offered in conjunction with, Asana Andiappan College of Yoga and Research Centre in India. This is the first time outside of India that such a program is being offered. Our classes are designed and taught in the same way as our instructors are taught. Predominantly from India, our instructors are fully learned not only in the practice of their discipline but also in the history and philosophy behind the practice. The resulting combination of grassroots knowledge both practical and theoretical in our programs give students more in-depth learning that they may able to find elsewhere in Hong Kong.

venue: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Anahata Yoga is a premiere yoga centre based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga. As a centre, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle. Anahata Yoga's 100 Hours Pranayama & Meditation Teacher Training Certificate Course gives yoga practitioners, enthusiasts, and aspiring instructors the chance to learn the art of mindfulness and mindful living. Through the course, students gain a better understanding of the basics of breathing, concentration and meditation techniques and how it influences the body and mind. We recognize that yoga is a popular pursuit in Hong Kong. People seek it out for its health benefits and often incorporate it into their active lifestyles. However, yoga instruction is not equal among the various yoga centers in Hong Kong. This is where our accredited Teacher Training Courses make all the difference. Our courses are accredited by and offered in conjunction with, Asana Andiappan College of Yoga and Research Centre in India. This is the first time outside of India that such a program is being offered. Our classes are designed and taught in the same way as our instructors are taught. Predominantly from India, our instructors are fully learned not only in the practice of their discipline but also in the history and philosophy behind the practice. The resulting combination of grassroots knowledge both practical and theoretical in our programs give students more in-depth learning that they may able to find elsewhere in Hong Kong.

title: 100-hours Prenatal Yoga Teacher Training Certificate Course
summary: 3rd November 2025 - 10th December 2025, Monday & Wednesday (6:30 pm - 9:30 pm)
organizer: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the heart
venue: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Anahata Yoga is a premiere yoga centre based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga. As a centre, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle. Anahata Yogaâ€™s Accredited 100 hours Prenatal Yoga Teacher Training Course (RPYT) is a comprehensive prenatal yoga certification program designed to equip aspiring yoga instructors with a strong foundational knowledge of physiology and anatomy in pregnancy. Students of the course will learn to support women in every stage of pregnancy, through delivery, and even into the early days of motherhood. The 100 hours Prenatal Yoga Teacher Training Course is a specialized program for yoga practitioners aspiring to teach yoga to pregnant women. Students are taught how various yogic practices are adapted and modified during various stages of pregnancy and early motherhood. Highly qualified and experienced instructors will teach the physical and mental changes that occur normally in a pregnant body, and how yoga can help promote a smooth pregnancy. At the end of this course, students will be able to deliver specific pre- and post-natal classes for pregnant women. title: 18-hour Aerial Yoga Teacher Training with Joanne Wu
summary: For Yoga instructors to expand their teaching repertoire and Aerial Yoga Practitioners to deepen their knowledge.
venue: The Yoga Room, 104 Jervois Street 4th Floor, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Date: 17-19 October 2025 (Fri-Sun)Time: Friday 18:30-2130, Saturday & Sunday 0900-1730Fee: HK$4,800 (Early Bird 1 month buffer), HK$5,200 (Regular)Venue: The Yoga Room * Maximum of 10 participants * English manual, bilingual teaching * Suitable for practitioners with 3+ months of Aerial yoga practice * Yoga Alliance Accredited certificate will be distributed upon completion to count towards continuing education hours. About this Teacher Training Course:Aerial Yoga is a suspension exercise that integrates traditional Yoga asana with concepts of aerial arts. This 18 hours Aerial Yoga teacher training serves as an entry point of your aspiring Aerial Yoga teaching journey as we will discuss topics including but not limited to the foundation and history of Aerial Yoga, set up, functional anatomy, teaching methodology, safety management and sequencing techniques. This course is designed for Yoga instructors to expand their teaching repertoire and Aerial Yoga Practitioners to deepen their knowledge. AgendaDay 1 - Friday 1830-2130 (3 hours) * 1 hour Aerial Yoga Decompression Class * Course introduction * Aerial Yoga background (history, development, philosophy) * Teaching methodology Day 2 - Saturday 0900-1830 (8.5 hour per day with 1 hour lunch 12:30 - 13:30) * 1 hour Aerial Yoga Class (Mobility) * Apparatus set-up * Guiding Principles of Aerial Yoga: flexibility, strength, decompression * Class Management: cueing, class planning, spotting and management, safety precautions * Anatomy and biomechanics * Art of Sequencing * Practicum Day 3 - Sunday 0900-1830 * 1 hour of Therapeutic Aerial Yoga Class * Advanced sequence * Anatomy and biomechanics * Sequence breakdown, analysis * Practicum * Teaching assessment (20 mins each) Please drop us an email at info@yogaroomhk.com / call 2544-8398 / WhatsApp 6685-9097 for details. Booking can also be made directly through our office, please contact us.

title: 200-hours Yoga Teacher Training Certificate Course
summary: Sunday Morning & Afternoon(10:00am - 1:00pm & 2:00pm - 5:00pm)10th August 2025 - 2nd November 2025
organizer: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the heart
venue: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Anahata Yoga is a premiere yoga centre based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga. As a centre, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle. Anahata Yogaâ€™s 200 Hours Teacher Training Certificate course gives yoga practitioners, enthusiasts, and aspiring instructors the chance to deepen their self-knowledge of yoga philosophy and improve on various aspects of their practice. It is an open-level training programme, suitable for those who have never done yoga before as well as those who have put in years of practice. Through the course, students gain a better understanding of yogaâ€™s origins, history, as well as its philosophy. Students also learn how they may improve on their postures, that they may execute them with accuracy and, later, be able to demonstrate it to others. We recognize that yoga is a popular pursuit in Hong Kong. People seek it out for its health benefits and often incorporate it into their active lifestyles. However, yoga instruction is not equal among the various yoga centres in Hong Kong. This is where our accredited Teacher Training Courses make all the difference. Our courses are accredited by and offered in conjunction with, Asana Andiappan College of Yoga and Research Centre in India. This is the first time outside of India that such a programme is being offered. Our classes are designed and taught in the same way as our instructors are taught. Predominantly from India, our instructors are fully learned not only in the practice of their discipline but also in the history and philosophy behind the practice. The resulting combination of grassroots knowledge both practical and theoretical in our programmes give students more in-depth learning that they may able to find elsewhere in Hong Kong.

title: 30-hr Yoga Nidra Teacher Training with Scott Moore
summary: Welcome back Scott Moore for an immersive four-day Yoga Nidra teacher training!
venue: The Yoga Room, 104 Jervois Street 4th Floor, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: What Makes This Training Unique: - Learn from a Yoga Nidra master to become a Yoga Nidra expert - Develop your authentic teaching voice rather than becoming a rote version of your teacher - Receive practical tools to create successful teaching opportunities - Gain immediate access to online course materials upon registration - Experience Scott's live online Yoga Nidra classes to observe expert facilitation What You'll Receive: - 30 hours of expert, in-depth Yoga Nidra Teacher Training - Comprehensive 160-page manual with scripts, exercises, and resources - PDF collection of over 100 pages of Yoga Nidra scripts - Lifetime access to all training recordings - Access to online course content for deeper study - Personal 30-minute consultation with Scott - Access to weekly live online Yoga Nidra classes - Yoga Alliance Continuing Education credit - Certificate of completion - Access to supportive online community

title: 300-hours Advanced Hatha Yoga Teacher Training Course Level 1 â€“ Level 3
summary: Breaks - 1 , 25 May 2026, 19 June 2026 & 1 Jul 2026
organizer: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the heart
venue: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Anahata Yoga is a premiere yoga centre based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga. As a centre, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle. The Level 1,2 Advanced Hatha Yoga Teacher Training Certificate Course is for yoga practitioners interested in growing their knowledge of Hatha yoga and developing their techniques in executing various Hatha yoga poses. The course is divided into 3 levels, each of which focuses on basic and intermediate poses, their possible modifications and variations, and teaching and demonstration techniques. The aim of the course is to challenge practitioners to advance in their practice by exploring the limits of their body and overcoming them, as well as to develop their knowledge of the body in order to better understand every joint and muscle nuance in the poses. By the end of the course, participants shall be able to demonstrate the wide range of Hatha yoga poses, explain their possible modifications and variations, and demonstrate the steps required to achieve the pose. Levels 1 and 2 of the course are of the same level of intensity but focus on different practical and teaching aspects of advanced practices hatha yoga. Level 1 covers Introduction of Hatha yoga, its origins, the basic anatomical details of the poses and its various approaches from the beginner's point of view. Proper Warm-up and preparatory practices are covered in detail. Level 2, on the other hand, covers other variations of the poses with deeper learning and practice. The student will get to practice many variations and modifications of the poses and learn how to modify as per their limitations. Level 3, students learn the teaching techniques of postures taught in the first two levels, as well as Partner Yoga variations, usage of straps, Chair Yoga, and the art of demonstration. Students also learn to sequence poses, teach the advanced Hatha yoga classes, and develop a class theme that focuses on various levels. As the final level in this series of training, Level 3 prepares students as Advanced Hatha Yoga Teachers. You can first take levels 1 & 2 and then the teacher will decide whether you are ready for level 3, after the completion of level 2 this time or wait for next time. Usually, we will have two advanced YTT in a year. This course is best suited for We recognize that yoga is a popular pursuit in Hong Kong. People seek it out for its health benefits and often incorporate it into their active lifestyles. However, yoga instruction is not equal among the various yoga centers in Hong Kong. This is where our accredited Teacher Training Courses make all the difference. Our courses are accredited by and offered in conjunction with, Asana Andiappan College of Yoga and Research Centre in India. This is the first time outside of India that such a program is being offered. Our classes are designed and taught in the same way as our instructors are taught. Predominantly from India, our instructors are fully learned not only in the practice of their discipline but also in the history and philosophy behind the practice. The resulting combination of grassroots knowledge both practical and theoretical in our programs give students more in-depth learning that they may able to find elsewhere in Hong Kong.

title: 300-hours Yoga Therapy and Ayurveda Teacher Training Certificate Course
summary: Breaks:Oct 20 - 26 and 29 Oct, Xmas - 22 Dec 2025 - 1Jan 2026. Class Schedule: 06th Oct 2025 - 16th Jan2026( Mon, Wed & Fri Morning)
organizer: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the heart
venue: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Anahata Yoga is a premier yoga center based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga. As a center, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle. We recognize that yoga is a popular pursuit in Hong Kong. People seek it out for its health benefits and often incorporate it into their active lifestyles. However, yoga instruction is not equal among the various yoga centers in Hong Kong. This is where our accredited Teacher Training Courses make all the difference. Our courses are accredited by, and offered in conjunction with, Asana Andiappan College of Yoga and Research Centre in India. This is the first time outside of India that such a programme is being offered. Our classes are designed and taught in the same way as our instructors are taught. Predominantly from India, our instructors are fully learned not only in the practice of their discipline, but also in the history and philosophy behind the practice. The resulting combination of grassroots knowledge both practical and theoretical in our programmes give students more in-depth learning than they may able to find elsewhere in Hong Kong. Yoga therapy and Ayurveda may be worlds apart, but through this specially-designed course, participants will be given a good introduction to the two sciences as well as a solid foundation on which to build their knowledge. The course is a good starting point for those interested in learning more about these two subjects. Explore the principles of yoga therapy and Ayurveda and their various applications in our daily lives. Understand the body, its functions and how to address common ailments through various yogic practice and Ayurvedic diet principles.

title: 50 HR YIN YOGA TEACHER TRAINING 2025
summary: Yoga Room is excited to welcome David Kim back to Hong Kong in Aug 2025 to lead this 50-hr Yin Yoga Teacher Training at the studio.
venue: The Yoga Room, 104 Jervois Street 4th Floor, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: ğŸ“Œ Price: â Level 1+2: HK$9,500 (Early-bird) HK$10,800 (Regular)Level 1: HK$ 6,300Level 2: HK$4,600ğŸ“Œ Dates:Level 1: 23-26 Aug, 2025 (Sat-Tue)Time: 8:30am-5pm Level 2: 29-31 Aug 2025 (Fri-Sun)Time: 8:30am â€“ 4:30pm (Friday & Saturday)Time: 8:30am â€“ 3:30pm (Sunday) ğŸ“Œ Venue: The Yoga Room Level 1: (30 hours) Materials Covered: The YogaWise Yin Yoga Teacher Training (Level 1) is designed for students and teachers who wish to develop a deeper knowledge of this multifaceted yoga style, and emerge with a working definition and basic teaching methodology for Yin Yoga. There will be a strong emphasis on Anatomy, highlighting skeletal variations, the role of connective tissue, and the nervous system. An introduction to mindfulness meditation will address the non-physical nature of this profoundly quieting practice. Key Features of the YogaWise Yin Yoga Training (Level 1) include: Specific Highlights: Level 2: (20 hours) Materials covered: The YogaWise Yin Yoga Teacher Training (Level 2) is designed for current Yin teachers or those already familiar with the basic orientation and language of Yin Yoga. This 20-Hour Level 2 course offers a closer examination of upper-body anatomy , and integrates the concept of myofascial meridians with practical sequencing strategies for both Yin and Yang classes. The course will also explore creative solutions and variations of Yin postures for students with limitations. Key Features of the YogaWise Yin Yoga Training (Level 2) include: Specific Highlights: Introduction to Myofascial Meridians Functional Anatomy for Yin Postural Variations: Mindfulness in Practice: About David Kim: DAVID KIM (E-RYT500) is a U.S.-based international Senior Yoga Teacher Trainer, who teaches both Yin and Vinyasa (YogaWorks) styles, and has led numerous 200- and 300-Hour Teacher Trainings, workshops, and retreats across the globe. Davidâ€™s passionate embrace of Yin Yoga owes a deep debt of gratitude to his mentors Paul & Suzee Grilley; to Sarah Powersâ€™s meditative grace; to the cumulative wisdom of cutting-edge anatomy and movement teachers; and to the dedicated students who have accompanied him along this path towards personal and spiritual awareness. David is a registered Continuing Education provider with Yoga Alliance (USA), and taking this course will allow you to receive 20, 30 or 50 Hours of Continuing Education credit with YA. Enquiry and Sign Up: Please drop us an email at info@yogaroomhk.com / call 2544-8398 / WhatsApp +852 6685 9097 (Click to start chat) for details.

title: Basic Plant Specimen Workshop
summary: Discover the fascinating world of herbaria and botanical science in our hands-on Basic Specimen Workshop!
venue: Dream Impact å¤¢å‰µæˆçœŸ, 4/F, 760 Cheung Sha Wan Road #Unit C, Lai Chi Kok, KOW, Hong Kong, Lai Chi Kok, KOW
description: Herbaria are at the core of botanical research, serving as permanent archives of invaluable plant information crucial for biodiversity, ecology, biogeography, evolution, conservation, and restoration efforts. Within each herbarium lies thousands to millions of preserved plant specimens, each carrying its own scientific significance, history, and natural beauty. But have you ever wondered what exactly a herbarium is, how itâ€™s organized, or how these specimens are made? In collaboration with Encompass HK and Pi Lab Limited, this hands-on workshop offers an introduction to the fundamentals of botany and plant specimen preparation. Guided by experts, youâ€™ll have the unique opportunity to create your very own herbarium specimenâ€”perfect to display at home or gift to loved onesâ€”while discovering how science and artistry come together in this timeless practice. Join us for an inspiring afternoon that blends science, nature, and creativityâ€”perfect for plant enthusiasts and curious minds alike! Remarks: Individuals with allergies to camphor or G6PD deficiency are advised not to participate in the workshop due to safety concerns.

You can experience the hand-drip process by Blue Bottle Coffee brewing tools and experience the same delicious coffee at the Blue Bottle Coffee cafe. â— Class Agenda - Blue Bottle Coffee Brand Introduction - Blue Bottle Coffee Hand-drip Brewing Kit introduction - Coffee Beans introduction - Hand-drip demonstration by barista - Experience and Q&A session We will have all brewing kits ready for you so that you do not need to prepare anything for the class, after school, you will get complimentary bag of coffee beans (200g) selected by the barista and The Art of Pour Over brewing guide to allow you to try out with our new knowledge at home. Save your spot. *The 75-minute course is mainly Cantonese-speaking. *Full payment for the registration and no refund or rescheduling. Blue Bottle Coffee shall notify participants for special arrangement for any inclement weather Please follow instagram @BlueBottleCoffeeHongKong for latest update

title: Candle-Making Workshop (Kids & Adults)
summary: Learn the basics of candle making and let your creativity run wild with our selection of scents, unique marbling technique and crystals.
venue: Hiraya Scent & Co. PMQ, 35è™Ÿ Aberdeen Street S412, 4th Floor, Block A, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Learn the basics of candle making and let your creativity run wild with our selection of scents, unique marbling technique and selection of crystal chips. As a cherry on top - this workshop comes with complimentary, celebratory drinks once the candle has been poured and is solidifying. Wine not? More on the experience: We start with an exploration of scents where you are can select your pick of 2 or 3 fragrances to blend together in order to create your own signature scents. This is followed by the basics of candle making where we calculate oil to wax ratios in which we also discuss the properties of our sustainable and non-toxic Coconut Apricot Wax and Luxury Fragrance Oils. We then get to the exciting part where you get to choose your design, be it a solid color candle in 7 color options or a multi-color marbled design. This part is completely DIY so you can let your creativity lead you. Our experienced host(s) will assist you when you need it of course! Once the candles are poured, complimentary mulled wine or mulled wine tea will be served. You can then sit back and relax and watch our candle experts design your candle tops as you like it or for the brave souls - give it a go yourself! Optional DIY labels will be offered too. But if you're too mesmerised by your gorgeous marbling design, feel free to opt out!

title: Canvas of Sound : A Harpistâ€™s Palette
summary: Immerse yourself in enchanting Harp melodies paired perfectly with original artwork by the harpist. Limited seats â€” reserve yours today !
venue: MG Tower, 133è™Ÿ Hoi Bun Road 10 æ¨“ E å®¤, Kwun tong, KOW, Hong Kong, Kwun tong, KOW
description: Welcome to Canvas of Sound : A Harpistâ€™s Palette! Join us for a magical morning filled with enchanting melodies and beautiful harmonies. Our talented harpist will paint a musical masterpiece that will transport you to a world of tranquility and serenity. Date: Sat Jul 26 2025 Time: 4:00 p.m. Location: MG Tower no.133, Hoi Bun Road floor 10E, Sky Music Studio Description: ğŸ¶âœ¨ Harp & Art: A Synesthetic Evening of Sound and Color ğŸ¨ğŸŒˆDebut Solo Concert â€“ This July in Hong Kong ğŸª‰â¤ï¸ Join me for a deeply personal and immersive evening where music and art come together in a unique expression of synesthesia â€” the connection between sound and color. Iâ€™ll be performing my first solo harp concert, and each piece is paired with original paintings Iâ€™ve created, inspired by the emotions and colors evoked through the music. This is more than a concert â€” itâ€™s a sensory journey through sound, art, and emotion. ğŸŒŸ All ticket proceeds after deducting all the relevant costs will be donated to:ğŸ•Š PARACLETE â€“ Care and Comfort Angels Project, a charity offering therapy and emotional support for those experiencing bereavement. PARACLETE holds special meaning for me and my mum â€” after my father passed away, they were there for her, offering steady support during a difficult time. This concert is my way of giving back to those who helped us heal. ğŸ¨ Original artworks will also be available for purchase after the show. A portion of those proceeds will go to PARACLETE as well. ğŸŸ Seating is limited â€“ for a more intimate and meaningful experience. Let the harp's delicate melodies and vibrant visuals transport you to a place of peace, color, and connection.Reserve your seat today and support causes that make a real difference.

title: Complicated Grief
summary: A peer support group to openly discuss shared experiences of complicated grief by The New Normal. All are welcome.
organizer: The New Normal Charity Hong Kong
venue: The Hive Wan Chai, 23 Luard Road 9/F, Wan Chai, HKI, Hong Kong, Wan Chai, HKI
description: What it is:Complicated Grief is a supportive space for those who feel their grief comes with added complexities, no matter the circumstance. Our peer-led groups provide a supportive and understanding environment for anyone navigating grief influenced by factors such as, but not limited to, suicide loss, estrangement, being cut off or distant from the person who died, traumatic loss, multiple losses, relationship breakdown or stigma. What happens:A peer support group is where people come together to share personal stories, listen and support one another with kindness. You will be welcomed by two hosts who are trained TNN volunteers with lived experience on the topic of the group. It is normal to feel nervous, and sharing can be a big decision. Remember you are deserving of care and support. You are welcome to join us and just listen. Our hosts will welcome you and provide an introduction, then we will ask you to introduce yourself and your reason for joining us. From then on there is no pressure to speak. Our hosts will facilitate the conversation. A peer support group is a supportive space where people can: Share stories and how our experiences are currently impacting our lives Talk about our feelings and emotions Share and discuss coping strategies Group guidelines: We have some basic guidelines that we ask everyone to adhere to, to ensure this remains an inclusive space for everyone: Please note: As a peer support group, this group is for peers to share their personal struggles and support one another. Attendees are welcome to come and listen but it is not a space to observe. You should attend to engage in peer support. It is not a space for students to contribute to their studies, for clinicians to observe, or for the press unless written agreement from the charity has been obtained. Who are The New Normal Charity? We are a Hong Kong S88 registered charity. The New Normal Hong Kong has been hosting our free peer support groups in Hong Kong since 2022. Our groups are facilitated by volunteers. While our hosts are trained to facilitate, we are not mental health professionals in this space. We do not give advice, we provide space for all of you to share, connect and support. Nobody should ever feel alone, and there is always somebody who can relate to your story. www.thenewnormalcharityhk.org If you are in crisis and donâ€™t feel like you can keep yourself safe, there are immediate services available. å±æ©Ÿæ±‚åŠ©ç†±ç·šå¦‚æœä½ è¦ºå¾—ä½ ä¸èƒ½ä¿è­‰è‡ªå·±çš„å®‰å…¨ Samaritans 2341 7227 (until 10pm) 2389 2222 (24/7) Caritas 18288 SPS Hotline 23820000 Address The Hive Wan Chai 9/F, The Phoenix, 23 Luard Rd, Wan Chai, Hong Kong How to get there 3 minute walk from Wan Chai Station: From Exit C, turn left and walk along Lockhart Road. Turn right when you reach Luard Road. Walk up Luard Road â€“ The Phoenix will be on your left.

title: Data Residency in a Fractured World: Overview Seminar

description: Welcome to this comprehensive presentation on data residency in today's fractured geopolitical landscape. As a Certified Sanctions Specialist, ex-Deloitte Risk Advisory Director, and ex-IBM Global Security Architect, I'll guide you through the complex web of international data regulations that impact legal and accounting professionals. We'll explore how geopolitical tensions are reshaping data sovereignty, examine the conflicting legal frameworks across jurisdictions, and provide practical strategies for navigating these challenges. This presentation is specifically designed for business professionals who need to understand data compliance without technical jargon.

description: Embark on a culinary adventure with our exclusive private class, "Discovering the Flavors of Vegan Thai Cuisine," designed for individuals or small groups eager to learn the secrets of traditional Thai cooking while embracing a plant-based lifestyle. In this intimate cooking experience, you'll have the opportunity to work closely with Chef Tina, a talented chef who specializes in vegan Thai cuisine. During this 3-hour class, you will experience how to make a variety of traditional Thai dishes using fresh, local ingredients. Chef Tina will guide you through the process of creating mouthwatering dishes like: After cooking, you can enjoy the delightful dishes youâ€™ve prepared together! Share stories, savor the flavors, and connect with your fellow culinary enthusiasts in a warm and inviting atmosphere. This dining experience is the perfect way to celebrate your culinary creations and enjoy a meal that reflects the rich tapestry of Thai culture. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced cook, this class caters to all skill levels.

description: Additional Information Welcome to the Pamela Peck Discovery Space! For guests holding a Friends of Discovery Space ticket, please book through the Friends of Discovery Space tab on the booking page with your unique FODS pass number. Pamela Peck Discovery Space is open for selective sessions from Mondays to Sundays: - Morning Session: 9:00 am â€“ 12:00 pm - Afternoon Session: 1:00 pm â€“ 4:00 pm If a specific session is not available for selection, the session is either full, blocked for a school excursion, internal event or deep cleaning & maintenance. Wearing of Masks Wearing of masks is not compulsory. Visitors are requested to wear mask should they have flu symptoms. 2. Consumption of Food and Drink Consumption of food and drink is discouraged. If children need to eat and/or drink, they should eat and/or drink at the outdoor picnic area. Please put rubbish in the litter bins provided. 3. Wearing Socks Adults are required to wear socks (no shoes allowed) in the indoor area. If necessary, you may approach the College Reception to purchase. 4. Safety of the Children Safety of the children is the primary responsibility of supervising parent(s)/carer(s) who accompany the children during the visit. Do not leave your children unattended. PPDS teachers are not in charge of children supervision. 5. Parent-Child Interaction Parent-child interaction is pivotal and the cornerstone of our work at PPDS, our teachers are here to facilitate activities and guide educational opportunities. 6. Visiting area of PPDS Use of PPDS is restricted to the ground floor facility, unless with express consent of the College. Visitors are not permitted to roam around the College. 7. Photography & Videography At Discovery Space we capture valuable moments during learning and produce a variety of different materials which we use to inform families, schools, and other organizations about the work that we do. The photographs/ videos may be used for promotional purpose to help us engage with other families, schools, and NGOs. 8. Fee/Refund Policy Tickets are non-refundable, non-transferable, and non-reschedulable. 9. Reservation of Rights The College reserves the rights of amendment to visitorsâ€™ guidelines without prior notice as circumstances require. 10. By registering and attending PPDS activities, visitorsâ€™ consent to the above guidelines is granted. *We are unable to accommodate walk-in visitors. Thank you for your understanding *

title: Dog shelter: New volunteer training with "Sai Kung Stray Friends"
summary: This program for animal lovers, will give you hands-on experience working as a member of our volunteer team caring for over 200 dogs.
organizer: Sai Kung Stray Friends Foundation Limited
venue: 151 Tai Lam Wu Rd, 151 Tai Lam Wu Road, Sai Kung, NT, Hong Kong, Sai Kung, NT
description: Sai Kung Stray Friends Foundation founded by Ms. Narelle Pamuk is a volunteer run charity that rescues and cares for stray dogs in Hong Kong. Our dog shelter in Sai Kung takes care of over 200 dogs. Our dedicated team of volunteers support our Kennel Manager Ms. Kathy to manage and operate the dog shelter for all 365 days of the year. The daily work routine includes walking the dogs, cleaning, cooking food, feeding the dogs, driving the dogs to the vets, deliver food & medical care to stray dogs around Sai Kung and Lok Ma Chau. Our team of volunteers come from diverse background and share a common love for dogs. This program is for animal lovers who are interested to join as a member of our team of volunteers. During the training, you will get to do the various house keeping tasks (cleaning, cooking, washing etc) to be done at shelter. Get to know the various dogs, understand differences of every dogs to take care when leashing/walking. And also get to know the dogs that new volunteers should not disturb. By the end of the day, you will have experienced the daily work routine of a regular volunteer at the shelter. You can then decide if you are able to commit to join our team and volunteer regularly every week. The training will be led by our senior volunteers. â â Each group will consist of 6-10 people. The training will be bi-lingual in Cantonese and English. â note1. Participants need to be above 16 yo of age commited to animal welfare. note2. Participants are required to sign the waiver of liability agreement note3. The organiser reserves the right to cancel the event for a specific date . In such case, you will be notified by email /whatsapp the reason for cancellation and provided a list of alternate dates that you can select based on your convenience.

Whether painting, running, or quietly thinking, a well-cared-for body is always your strongest partner. Psychologist Snyder's "Hope Theory" suggests a healthy body is not only the result of hope but also a source of hope. When we nourish our bodies through food, we build motivation to chase goals and strengthen problem-solving ability. When it comes to health, something as intuitive as eating has become unnecessarily complicated; what nourishes us has now caused problems. How might we eat properly without compromising gastronomical pursuits? Hereâ€™s a good news from the leading artist Tung: thereâ€™s a way out! In this workshop on food and body awareness, fitness coach/writer Yat will lead us through muscle training. Subsequently, chef/editor Alan will prepare a healthy, light meal. Explore how food helps your body reach its ideal state and responds to creativity and exercise rhythms. Starting with "eat well,â€ we'll make food an integral part of our cultural practice as a way to â€œlive wellâ€ with hope. _______________________ è²»ç”¨å…¨å…(åƒåŠ è€…é ˆé ç¹³æ¸¯å¹£100å…ƒå¯é€€é‚„æŒ‰é‡‘) Free (participants are required to settle a refundable deposit at HKD100 to secure their registration) _______________________ å°å¸« Instructors ç¾…ç¶­æ—¥ï¼ˆé˜¿æ—¥ï¼‰Law Wai Yat (Yat) å¥é½¡13å¹´ï¼Œç”±35å‹è‚šè…©åˆ°24/7è…¹è‚Œï¼ŒæœŸæœ›è«¸å›é£Ÿå¾—é–‹å¿ƒæ“å¾—é †å¿ƒï¼Œä¸å†æŠŠç™½çƒšç„¡é¹½èª¤æœƒæˆå¥åº·çš„ä¸äºŒæ³•é–€ã€‚ With 13 years of fitness experience, gone from a 35-inch waist to having abs all day. description: Annie Cheung, actress and playwright of the solo performance DOTS, is offering an open dress rehearsal performance of DOTS before its formal run at the Edinburgh Fringe in August this year. As a form of self-exploration and revelation, this performance creates a space for conversations about mental health and resilience. Amy Hung, expressive arts therapist and drama educator, will join Annie in the post-show sharing session to discuss the concepts and messages behind the performance. As a Mental Health Ambassador at Mind HK, Annie shares her mental health recovery journey with the community. This campaign encourages the public to look beyond the typical, stigmatising, labels associated with mental health diagnoses. Through personal stories of mental health journeys, we want to showcase realistic portrayals of people who have faced mental health problems and recovered and depict their holistic identity. With this campaign, we hope to raise awareness of the stigma towards persons with mental health conditions, celebrate the resilience and strength of people in recovery, and educate and equip the public with mental health knowledge. title: Family Day - Earth Art For Children
summary: Earth sculpture, painting with natural pigments, imprints, incorporating foraged natural objects.
venue: Ark Eden, 11 Tung Hang Mei Mui Wo, Lantau Island, NT, Hong Kong, Lantau Island, NT
description: Dates: October 29th â€“ November 30th Join us for a transformative experience this fall at the Natural Building Workshops, a unique collaboration between Alex from Bisque-kit, Ania from Ania Natural Materials, and Jenny from Ark Eden. This hands-on series is designed to introduce participants to sustainable building techniques, reconnect them with nature, and nurture creativity in the process. Our expert instructors bring a wealth of knowledge and diverse experience from around the globe: Together, these three professionals bring expertise in architectural design, hands-on natural building, and environmental sustainability to create an unforgettable learning experience.Family Day: Earth Art For Children (October 29th) Family Day: A Fun Introduction to Earth Building Weâ€™re kicking off the series with a family-friendly day thatâ€™s all about play, creativity, and getting in touch with nature. This relaxed and interactive workshop is ideal for children and families to explore natural building materials, create art, and try out basic building techniques in a fun, creative environment. The day will include earth sculptures, painting with natural pigments, imprinting and incorporating foraged items! natural objects. Terms and Conditions: Workshop Safety & Participation Disclaimer All participants in the Earth Building Workshop Series do so at their own risk. While the activities are designed to be low-risk and suitable for beginners, they involve natural building materials such as clay, sand, straw, bamboo, and tools like trowels or shovels. By attending, participants acknowledge that: -They will follow the instructions of the workshop leaders at all times -They understand the nature of the physical activities involved, including manual mixing, lifting, and sculpting with earth materials -Children under 16 must be supervised by a parent or designated responsible adult The organizers will provide basic protective items (e.g. gloves), hydration stations, and shaded areas, but recommend that participants bring appropriate clothing, footwear, and sun protection. The workshop area will be kept clean and hazard-free to the best of our ability, and the team reserves the right to stop or adjust any activity for safety reasons.

title: Gajen Nad: Global Malaysian Chindian
summary: Gajen Nad is a Malaysian stand-up comedian, emcee, and motivational speaker. Gajen is known for his clean & intellectual humor.
venue: BaseHall 2, 1 Connaught Place #15 LG/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: In 2012, Gajen Nad took his first steps into stand-up comedy and event emceeing. After 6 years of balancing his passion with a corporate career, he made a bold move in 2018 to pursue comedy full-time. His dedication paid off when, last year, his comedy special, Professional Mixed Breed, premiered globally on Netflix, marking a major milestone as the first Penang-born comedian to achieve this. With over a decade of experience and over 1,000 events under his belt, he is known for his corporate-friendly and intelligent comedy suited for everyone! Here's what Gajen has to say about this show: "Listen, I mean read, here is my brand new 1-hour comedy special, Global Malaysian Chindian." This is a sequel to my previous special, Professional Mixed Breed, in 2022 (it's on Netflix!). In this show, I go deep into my roots and beginnings. From my Chindian childhood in the 90s, strict Indian family career expectations, engineering life, my Germany adventures, and...my niche toilet preferences. As always, the jokes are clean, culturally relatable, and perfect for locals and international friends alike! Bring your friends, dates, parents...even your ex. I promise it wonâ€™t be weird. See you soon!" This show is in English

title: Good Grief
summary: A peer support group to openly discuss shared experiences of grief by The New Normal. All are welcome.
organizer: The New Normal Charity Hong Kong
venue: The Hive Wan Chai, 23 Luard Road 9/F, Wan Chai, HKI, Hong Kong, Wan Chai, HKI
description: What it is Good Grief is a free peer support group for anyone who has experienced/to talk about grief and bereavement. Our peer support groups are free to join. Good Grief provides a supportive, judgment-free space where people can share their experiences of loss, connect with others who understand, and find comfort as a collective. Led by trained hosts, our sessions offer a supportive environment to navigate grief together. What happens A peer support group is where people come together to share personal stories, listen and support one another with kindness. You will be welcomed by two hosts who are trained TNN volunteers with lived experience in the topic of the group. It is normal to feel nervous, and sharing can be a big decision. Remember you are deserving of care and support. You are welcome to join us and just listen. Our hosts will welcome you and provide an introduction, then we will ask you to introduce yourself and your reason for joining us. From then on there is no pressure to speak. Our hosts will facilitate conversation. A peer support group is a supportive space where people can: Share stories and how our experiences are currently impacting our lives Talk about our feelings and emotions Share and discuss coping strategies Group guidelines We have some basic guidance that we ask everyone to adhere to, to ensure this remains an inclusive space for everyone: Please note As a peer support group, this group is for peers to share their personal struggles and support one another. Attendees are welcome to come and listen but it is not a space to observe. You should attend to engage in peer support. It is not a space for students to contribute to their studies, for clinicians to observe, or for the press unless written agreement from the charity has been obtained. Who are The New Normal Charity? We are a Hong Kong S88 registered charity. The New Normal Hong Kong have been hosting our free peer support groups in Hong Kong since 2022. Our groups are facilitated by volunteers. While our hosts are trained to facilitate, we are not mental health professionals in this space. We do not give advice, we provide space for all of you to share, connect and support. Nobody should ever feel alone, and there is always somebody who can relate to your story. www.thenewnormalcharityhk.org If you are in crisis and donâ€™t feel like you can keep yourself safe there are immediate services available. å±æ©Ÿæ±‚åŠ©ç†±ç·šå¦‚æœä½ è¦ºå¾—ä½ ä¸èƒ½ä¿è­‰è‡ªå·±çš„å®‰å…¨ Samaritans 2341 7227 (until 10pm) 2389 2222 (24/7) Caritas 18288 SPS Hotline 23820000 Address The Hive Wan Chai 9/F, The Phoenix, 23 Luard Rd, Wan Chai, Hong Kong How to get there 3 minute walk from Wan Chai Station: From Exit C, turn left and walk along Lockhart Road. Turn right when you reach Luard Road. Walk up Luard Road â€“ The Phoenix will be on your left.

title: Grounding Techniques for Arm Balances, Backbends & Inversions
summary: Grounding and Centering are two essential elements in our Yoga practice.
venue: The Yoga Room, 104 Jervois Street 4th Floor, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: By grounding, we are connecting the energy to the earth and obtaining stability; While by centering, we bring the energy into our body and our core. In this workshop, Jackie is going to introduce the techniques of grounding and centering. Also, we are going to explore how these techniques are going to help our Asana practice. Dates: 10,24 Aug + 21,28 Sept 2025 (Sundays) Time: 11:15am-1:15pm Fee: HK$450@session, HK$1,520 for all 4 sessionsVenue: The Yoga Room Foundation: understanding about grounding and centering Date: 10 Aug2025 Physical practice and breathing exercises, alongside with basic anatomy will be introduced. Arm Balance Date: 24 Aug2025 Arm balance asanas will be introduced. In this workshop, Jackie will explain how grounding and Centering helps getting into the poses and also the anatomical knowledge behind them. Backbendings Date: 21 Sept 2025 Grounding and Centering are helpful in obtaining a safe backbending practice. title: GuWei Museum visit with afternoon tea set
summary: Join us for a 1.5-hour guided tour of GuWei Museum, featuring the "Wanli Shipwreck" exhibition and afternoon tea with stunning views!
venue: GuWei Museum, 21 Wong Chuk Hang Road #33/F, Wong Chuk Hang, HKI, Hong Kong, Wong Chuk Hang, HKI
description: In this special visit, we will explore the GuWei Museum with an expert guided tour lasting 1.5 hours. We will conclude with afternoon tea, enjoying stunning panoramic views of Aberdeen Lower Reservoir and Lamma Island at the Museum Coffee Shop. The GuWei Museum is committed to passing on both Chinese and foreign traditional cultures to the next generation by organizing exhibitions and cultural and educational activities. During this visit, you will have the opportunity to view the new exhibition, â€œThe Wanli Shipwreck: Blue-and-White Porcelain in Global Trade.â€ Our guide will share insights about their collection and the stories behind it. Date and Time: July 19 (Sat) 2:30-4pm (Guided Tour), Afternoon tea after tour Fee: $160/person. Fee includes guided 1.5-hour guided tour, along with an afternoon tea set that features coffee or tea and a cake. About Guwei Museum www.guweimuseum.comCo-founded by Mr. Franco Cutrupia, Chairman of the Sapientia Foundation, and his wife, Ms. Pauline Ngai Cutrupia, the GuWei Museum is the first private museum in the Southern District to blend exhibitions, cultural education, and leisure. Opened to the public on 24 September 2024, the museum features a diverse collection of 1,035 artefacts from various historical periods and regions worldwide. These include porcelainware, silverware, carpets, paintings, textiles, and jewellery, inviting visitors to explore the distinctive patterns, forms, and colours that represent both Eastern and Western cultures. In addition to its exhibitions, the museum offers a vibrant array of workshops and programmes for all ages, inspiring creativity and bringing fresh dynamism to Hong Kong's cultural landscape.

title: Healing Hearts
summary: A peer support group for anyone in any stage of a breakup by The New Normal. All are welcome.
organizer: The New Normal Charity Hong Kong
venue: The Hive Wan Chai, 23 Luard Road 9/F, Wan Chai, HKI, Hong Kong, Wan Chai, HKI
description: What it is Healing Hearts is a peer support group for anyone navigating the challenges of a breakup, divorce, or separation. Our support space offers connection, understanding, and shared experiences to help process emotions and share strategies to cope. What happens A peer support group is where people come together to share personal stories, listen and support one another with kindness. You will be welcomed by two hosts who are trained TNN volunteers with lived experience on the topic of the group. It is normal to feel nervous, and sharing can be a big decision. Remember you are deserving of care and support. You are welcome to join us and just listen. Our hosts will welcome you and provide an introduction, then we will ask you to introduce yourself and your reason for joining us. From then on there is no pressure to speak. Our hosts will facilitate the conversation. A peer support group is a supportive space where people can: Share stories and how our experiences are currently impacting our lives Talk about our feelings and emotions Share and discuss coping strategies Group guidelines We have some basic guidelines that we ask everyone to adhere to, to ensure this remains an inclusive space for everyone: Please note As a peer support group, this group is for peers to share their personal struggles and support one another. Attendees are welcome to come and listen but it is not a space to observe. You should attend to engage in peer support. It is not a space for students to contribute to their studies, for clinicians to observe, or for the press unless written agreement from the charity has been obtained. Who are The New Normal Charity? We are a Hong Kong S88 registered charity. The New Normal Hong Kong has been hosting our free peer support groups in Hong Kong since 2022. Our groups are facilitated by volunteers. While our hosts are trained to facilitate, we are not mental health professionals in this space. We do not give advice, we provide space for all of you to share, connect and support. Nobody should ever feel alone, and there is always somebody who can relate to your story. If you are in crisis and donâ€™t feel like you can keep yourself safe, there are immediate services available. www.thenewnormalcharityhk.org å±æ©Ÿæ±‚åŠ©ç†±ç·šå¦‚æœä½ è¦ºå¾—ä½ ä¸èƒ½ä¿è­‰è‡ªå·±çš„å®‰å…¨ Samaritans 2341 7227 (until 10pm) 2389 2222 (24/7) Caritas 18288 SPS Hotline 23820000 Address The Hive Wan Chai 9/F, The Phoenix, 23 Luard Rd, Wan Chai, Hong Kong How to get there 3 minute walk from Wan Chai Station: From Exit C, turn left and walk along Lockhart Road. Turn right when you reach Luard Road. Walk up Luard Road â€“ The Phoenix will be on your left.

title: IFINEXPO HK - Connecting the Financial Ecosystem
summary: Connect the financial industry chain and provide information resources and solutions for the financial industry.
venue: 3/F, Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre, 1è™Ÿ åšè¦½é“, Wan Chai District, HKI, Hong Kong, Wan Chai District, HKI
description: The grand event opens, and the financial blueprint is drawn together In this rapidly changing financial era, IFINEXPO Hong Kong International Financial Expo, as a brilliant event in the financial community of Asia and even the world, is about to open brilliantly! We sincerely invite global financial elites, innovative enterprises, investment institutions and industry pioneers to gather in the Pearl of the Orient - Hong Kong, and work together to build an unprecedented knowledge sharing and resource docking platform, so that every drop of financial water can be accurately irrigated, and the industry can move towards a more efficient and intelligent future. Exhibition area: Kaleidoscope of financial innovation Stepping into the exhibition area is like stepping into a dream world of financial technology. From the latest application of blockchain technology to the precise practice of artificial intelligence in financial risk control, from the sustainable development plan of green finance to the cutting-edge exploration of digital currency, hundreds of exhibitors will showcase their latest achievements and solutions here. This is not only a feast of vision and technology, but also the best example of the integration of financial innovation and tradition, so that every visitor can feel the strong beating of the financial pulse. Conference Forum: The collision of wisdom, the spark of thought The conference forum area is a stage for the confrontation of ideas and the collision of wisdom. We have carefully planned a series of high-end dialogues, keynote speeches and roundtable forums, inviting well-known scholars, financial industry experts and corporate leaders from home and abroad to discuss the latest trends in financial technology, regulatory policies, market opportunities and challenges and other hot topics around the theme of "building a platform for knowledge sharing and resource docking to make finance more efficient". Here, every exchange may inspire new inspiration, and every handshake may lead to the spark of cooperation. Resource docking: building a bridge for cooperation IFINEXPO is not only a platform for display and learning, but also a bridge to promote efficient resource docking. We have specially set up a business docking area to provide exhibitors, investors, entrepreneurs, financial institutions, agents, traders, etc. with one-on-one communication opportunities to help project incubation, capital introduction, technical cooperation, market expansion and investment learning. Here, every idea may find its mentor, and every effort will get due rewards. Go hand in hand and create brilliance together IFINEXPO Hong Kong International Financial Expo is a grand event in the financial industry and a preview of the future financial ecology. In this era full of opportunities and challenges, let us work together to build a more efficient, inclusive and sustainable financial future with an open mind, innovative thinking and pragmatic actions. We look forward to meeting you at IFINEXPO and opening a new chapter in finance together! Contact us: twinkle@ifinexpo.com guopei@ifinexpo.com WhatsAppï¼š+86 18621737740
