title: Introduction to Improv Course (101) - Fall Term
summary: Discover and learn the foundations to creating improvised performance in this 8-week course!
venue: Fringe Club, 2 Lower Albert Road Underground Theatre, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Overview Watched improv comedy and thought "I'd like to give that a try"? An actor looking to train up on ever popular improv skills? Needing help with public speaking skills? Just wanting to be comfortable not knowing what'll happen next? Whoever you are, whatever your background, if you're wanting to learn the skills of improv from the start and to be left with a solid grounding in improv, then this is the course for you. Over 8-weeks, discover - through the supportive, collaborative process we call improv performance - how to create stories, characters and ideas to captivate an audience right before their eyes. Develop those public speaking skills to allow easier and more natural dialogs with your audience. Learn how to relish the opportunity to embrace the unexpected! Topics covered by this workshop Dates and Times: Monday evenings, 7:00pm-9:30pmSep 8, 15, 22, 29Oct 13, 20, 27Nov 3(Note: No class Oct 6)Course Fee:Earlybird*: $1,900 ($237.5/class, $95/hr)Regular: $3,000 ($375/class, $150/hr)*Earlybird pricing ends 18th August Our TBC Course Structure Explained:Our courses and classes have 2 defining numbers. The first number defines the level.100 series - Introductory200 series - Intermediate300 series - Advancedetc.Then the 01, 02, 03 etc. defines the type of class.101 Intro to Improv (building blocks) |102 Intro to Shortform |103 Intro to Longform What have our 101 students said about the series? " A part of me didn't want the 101 to finish. It was such great experience and it really helped me to explore the different area of my brain." " Thanks for the 101 it was so muchlies fun." " Really so grateful that I hopped into 101 - the learning has been great and this has been some much needed joy, silliness and connection with new pals." ----- Logistics: Please arrive 5-10 minutes early - we will start on time. Wear comfortable clothes and shoes as we will stand and be active. Ages 16+. All are welcome, no previous improv experience required. Bring your own water bottle, there is no water available at the premises. Come ready to learn and hone your craft!

title: Introduction to Shortform Improv Course (102) - Fall Term
summary: Discover and learn the foundations of shortform improv (all the fun games!) in this 8-week course!
venue: Fringe Club, 2 Lower Albert Road Underground Theatre, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Overview Ever since the explosion of TV show "Who's Line is it Anyway?", the short-form style of improv (consisting of short scenes combining audience suggestions, improviser talents and pre-selected rules) has become synonymous with improv comedy. Though by no means the only style of improv, it is one that TBC Improv specialises in and this course will teach you the techniques behind it. Each class in the 8-week course will explore a particular genre of game: what games fall into the category, what skills they use and techniques for performing scenes within them. Become familiar with new games and reacquainted with old favourites! This course is ideally aimed at: those with some basic improv training and wishing to expand further; those who wish to specialise in short-form improv; performers with long-form background/experience wishing to become more relaxed and familiar with short-form improv. title: IT for Scrum Masters
summary: One-day workshop for Scrum Masters with no technical background to boost IT confidence, bridge tech gaps, and engage in technical
venue: Playground Coworking, 244-248 Des Voeux Road Central #11/F, Sheung Wan, HKI, Hong Kong, Sheung Wan, HKI
description: What happens when technical conversations go over your head? When decisions are made based on jargon you donâ€™t fully understand? Or when you want to uncover whatâ€™s slowing down delivery without always needing a developer to translate? The age-old debate: should a Scrum Master be technical? Itâ€™s a hot topic, one that sparks discussions, debates, confusion, curiosity, and even controversy. But the answer is actually quite simple: it doesnâ€™t really matter. There are highly successful technical Scrum Masters, and there are non-technical ones who fail miserably, and vice versa. It depends on many factors. But one thing is certain: having technical knowledge in your Scrum backpack is never a bad thing. This one-day workshop wonâ€™t turn you into a full-fledged Developer, that would be absurd to promise. What it will do is give you a solid foundation in IT and software engineering without writing a single line of code. Facilitated by seasoned technical trainers whoâ€™ve worked in the trenches, supported by the collective knowledge of the group, and yes, letâ€™s be real, some help from AI, weâ€™ll explore key technical concepts and dive into modern development workflows. Whether youâ€™re dealing with legacy systems, cloud-native platforms, or anything in between, this day will equip you to ask better questions, spot risks earlier, engage more confidently in technical discussions, and foster stronger collaboration with your Developers, technical stakeholders, and teams while staying true to the Scrum Master accountabilities.

title: Laughs for Change - Open Mic Night
summary: Share their observations on social issues, relationships, and cultural nuances through the lens of comedy!
venue: The Aftermath, 57-59 Wyndham Street #Lower G/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: You are invited to Laughs for Change, an open mic night dedicated to using humor as a powerful tool for social commentary! This is a space where speakers, storytellers and comedians can share their observations on social issues, the environment, relationships, mental health, cultural nuances and just about anything related to the human experience through the lens of comedy. This event is in collaboration with Nerd Nite Hong Kong, a lecture event that aims at a casual, relaxed, and letâ€™s be honest, slightly inebriated evening of academic fun times. If you have a great time with our evening of laughter, you might find yourself invited to share your thoughts at Nerd Nite! What to Expect: Open to All: This event welcomes performers from all backgrounds and experience levels to share their insights and humor. Supportive Community: Connect with fellow speakers and audience members who appreciate the power of humor to challenge the status quo. Open Mic Format: Each performer will have up 6 minutes to showcase their material. All performances will be in English. Limited to 8 spots only. Door opens at 6:30 and the event will start at 7pm.

title: Mind HK: Standard Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) Course (Nov 1 & 2) + MH101
summary: MHFA is the help given to someone who is developing or experiencing a mental health crisis before he/she can obtain professional treatment.
venue: Mind Hong Kong, 18B, One Capital Place, Mind HK, 18B, One Capital Place 18 Luard Road, Wan Chai, Hong Kong, Wan Chai
description: What is MHFA? MHFA is an internationally accredited qualification that provides lay people with practical guidelines and protocols to assess and directly help those experiencing or developing a mental health problem or crisis. The MHFA course will be facilitated by certified MHFA instructors. There will be role-plays and group discussions for practices. Participants will receive a set of Standard MHFA course material and will be awarded a certificate upon 100% attendance. The Standard MHFA Course will cover: Course detail: We encourage you to take our Mental Health 101 Webinar foundational literacy course prior to registering for this MHFA Course. You will receive a free entry ticket to our upcoming Mental Health 101 Webinar scheduled 5 September, 18:00-19:00, if you register for this MHFA Course. The Zoom link for this free webinar will be emailed to you 3 days prior to the course start date. Course pricing: Certification: You will be awarded an MHFA certificate upon 100% attendance. Registration detail: We will offer more mental health training courses in the future. Please stay tuned to our website www.mind.org.hk and social media for more information regarding upcoming training courses. For queries, please contact us at training@mind.org.hk.

title: Natural Building Workshops: Earth Sgraffito (2-Day Workshop)
summary: "Sgraffito" comes from the Italian word "sgraffiare," - "to scratch," where a surface is decorated by revealing contrasting colours beneath
datesAndTimes: November 29 Â· 10am - November 30 Â· 4:30am HKT.Doors at 9:45am
venue: Ark Eden, 11 Tung Hang Mei Mui Wo, Lantau Island, NT, Hong Kong, Lantau Island, NT
description: Join us for a transformative experience this fall at the Natural Building Workshops, a unique collaboration between Alex from Bisque-kit, Ania from Ania Natural Materials, and Jenny from Ark Eden. This hands-on series is designed to introduce participants to sustainable building techniques, reconnect them with nature, and nurture creativity in the process. Our expert instructors bring a wealth of knowledge and diverse experience from around the globe: Together, these three professionals bring expertise in architectural design, hands-on natural building, and environmental sustainability to create an unforgettable learning experience. Discover the fascinating world of sgraffito, an ancient decorative technique used in clay plastering to create intricate, textured designs by scratching through a layer of material to reveal contrasting colors beneath. This method, originating from Italy, has been used for centuries in architecture and art, offering a unique way to add depth and detail to surfaces. In this 2-day workshop, you'll learn both the history and the hands-on practice of sgraffito. Day 1: We begin with an introduction to the history and theory behind sgraffito, exploring its cultural significance and uses throughout time. Then, you'll dive into the practice by collaborating on a large wall design, learning the technique together as you scratch through layers of clay and pigment. Day 2: On the second day, you'll have the opportunity to design and execute your own personalized sgraffito artwork. We will guide you through the process of creating custom colors from mineral pigments and clay, as well as incorporating natural elements like crushed shells and glass for added texture and vibrancy. By the end of the workshop, youâ€™ll leave with your own unique sgraffito piece, a deeper understanding of this ancient technique, and the skills to incorporate it into future creative projects. In between your morning and afternoon workshops, participants will enjoy a freshly made vegetarian buffet lunch and light refreshments are available through out the day. Participants will receive a comprehensive information package upon ticket purchase, which will include details on how to get to the site, what to wear, and other essential information. Special Discounts:We offer discounted prices for students with a valid student ID. Whether you're passionate about sustainable living, keen to try new creative skills, or simply curious about building with natural materials, this series of workshops will empower you to make a meaningful connection to the earth and learn new skills that can last a lifetime. NOTE: A one day ticket is available for students. This is only available for saturday's session. For any questions please email: hibisquekit@gmail.com or visit our instagram page @bisque.kit Terms and Conditions: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Weâ€™re kicking off the series with a family-friendly day on 29th October thatâ€™s all about play, creativity, and getting in touch with nature. This relaxed and interactive workshop is ideal for children and families to explore natural building materials, create art, and try out basic building techniques in a fun, creative environment. Following the family day, our specialized workshops dive deeper into natural building methods and are perfect for adults and older children. These workshops combine learning with hands-on experience as participants work on a live project and see their efforts come to life!Workshops include: Discounted Workshop Packages:Participants can choose to attend one individual workshop or purchase a discounted package for 4 workshops. Each workshop is offered on two dates, so you can pick the dates that work best for you. Please return to the event collection page to see these offers. Statement of Intent: The Earth Building Workshop Series, hosted by Bisque-kit in collaboration with Ark Eden and Ania ChorzÄ™pa, is a temporary, educational initiative focused on teaching natural building methods in a hands-on and environmentally conscious way. The project is not commercial in nature and is intended to support environmental education, community engagement, and creativity. All structures built during the workshops are: Any elements constructed during the workshops are either: The goal is to explore sustainable construction techniques while minimizing environmental impact and remaining respectful of existing planning and building regulations. The team commits to responsible site use, maintaining safety and cleanliness at all times, and keeping communication open with relevant authorities and the local community. Workshop Safety & Participation Disclaimer All participants in the Earth Building Workshop Series do so at their own risk. While the activities are designed to be low-risk and suitable for beginners, they involve natural building materials such as clay, sand, straw, bamboo, and tools like trowels or shovels. By attending, participants acknowledge that: -They will follow the instructions of the workshop leaders at all times -They understand the nature of the physical activities involved, including manual mixing, lifting, and sculpting with earth materials -Children under 16 must be supervised by a parent or designated responsible adult The organizers will provide basic protective items (e.g. gloves), hydration stations, and shaded areas, but recommend that participants bring appropriate clothing, footwear, and sun protection. The workshop area will be kept clean and hazard-free to the best of our ability, and the team reserves the right to stop or adjust any activity for safety reasons.

title: Otherwise Employed
summary: A peer support group for anyone who is unemployed, not working full time, or finding it hard by The New Normal. All are welcome.
organizer: The New Normal Charity Hong Kong
venue: 16/f Chun Wo Commercial Centre, 23-27 Wing Wo Street, Sheung Wan, HKI, Hong Kong, Sheung Wan, HKI
description: What it isOtherwise Employed is a peer group for anyone who is unemployed or not working full time and finding it hard. Lots of things make being â€˜Otherwise Employedâ€™ hard. You might be in this position involuntarily, experiencing financial pressures, loss of identity, routine, or purpose, facing rejection in your job search, feeling lonely, or uncertain about the future. This is a forum for people to share the difficult emotions around not being in full-time employment, which provides not only income but also an identity, structure to your day, social contact, and often a purpose. What this is not - A forum to discuss the practicalities of job searches - A networking opportunity What happens A peer support group is where people come together to share personal stories, listen and support one another with kindness. You will be welcomed by two hosts who are trained TNN volunteers with lived experience in the topic of the group. It is normal to feel nervous, and sharing can be a big decision. Remember you are deserving of care and support. You are welcome to join us and just listen. Our hosts will welcome you and provide an introduction, then we will ask you to introduce yourself and your reason for joining us. From then on there is no pressure to speak. Our hosts will facilitate conversation. A peer support group is a supportive space where people can: Share stories and how our experiences are currently impacting our lives Talk about our feelings and emotions Share and discuss coping strategies Group guidelines We have some basic guidance that we ask everyone to adhere to, to ensure this remains an inclusive space for everyone: Please note As a peer support group, this group is for peers to share their personal struggles and support one another. Attendees are welcome to come and listen but it is not a space to observe. You should attend to engage in peer support. It is not a space for students to contribute to their studies, for clinicians to observe, or for the press unless written agreement from the charity has been obtained. Who are The New Normal Charity? We are a Hong Kong S88 registered charity. The New Normal Hong Kong has been hosting our free peer support groups in Hong Kong since 2022. Our groups are facilitated by volunteers. While our hosts are trained to facilitate, we are not mental health professionals in this space. We do not give advice, we provide space for all of you to share, connect and support. Nobody should ever feel alone, and there is always somebody who can relate to your story. www.thenewnormalcharityhk.org If you are in crisis and donâ€™t feel like you can keep yourself safe there are immediate services available. å±æ©Ÿæ±‚åŠ©ç†±ç·šå¦‚æœä½ è¦ºå¾—ä½ ä¸èƒ½ä¿è­‰è‡ªå·±çš„å®‰å…¨ Samaritans 2341 7227 (until 10pm) 2389 2222 (24/7) Caritas 18288 SPS Hotline 23820000 Address WYNG 16/F, Chun Wo Commercial Centre 23-27 Wing Wo Street, Sheung Wan, Hong Kong Island How to get there 2 minute walk from Sheung Wan Station:From Exit E1, turn right and walk along Des Voeux Rd Central. Cross Wing Lok Street, then turn right onto Wing Wo Street (the first street after you cross). The building will be on your left.

title: Pik-Sum & friends: Very Chinese Music
summary: Join Pik-Sum and friends for a mesmerizing evening of Erhu at the century stone house this July!
venue: allure customised hair, 3 School Street Tai Hang, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Step into the enchanting century-old Allure stone house for an extraordinary evening of ancient Chinese melodies that will leave you spellbound. This time, renowned Erhu virtuoso Chan Pik-Sum returns with an exciting new ensemble to captivate audiences once again. With the hauntingly beautiful sounds of the Erhu, Yangqin, and Sanxian, prepare for a sensory journey that seamlessly blends tradition with timeless artistry. This is more than musicâ€”itâ€™s an experience steeped in elegance, emotion, and undeniable charm. èµ°é€²Allureçš„ç™¾å¹´çŸ³å±‹ï¼Œäº«å—ä¸€å ´ä»¤äººè‘—è¿·çš„å¤ä»£ä¸­åœ‹æ—‹å¾‹ä¹‹å¤œã€‚è‘—åäºŒèƒ¡æ¼”å¥å®¶é™³ç’§æ²æ­¤æ¬¡å¸¶è‘—å…¨æ–°çµ„åˆå›æ­¸ï¼Œå†æ¬¡ç‚ºè§€çœ¾å¸¶ä¾†æ‰£äººå¿ƒå¼¦çš„éŸ³æ¨‚é«”é©—ã€‚ä¼´éš¨è‘—äºŒèƒ¡ã€æšç´èˆ‡ä¸‰å¼¦é‚£å‹•äººå¿ƒé­„çš„æ‚…è€³è²éŸ³ï¼Œæº–å‚™å¥½å±•é–‹ä¸€å ´èåˆå‚³çµ±èˆ‡æ°¸æ†è—è¡“çš„æ„Ÿå®˜æ—…ç¨‹ã€‚é€™ä¸åƒ…åƒ…æ˜¯éŸ³æ¨‚ï¼Œè€Œæ˜¯ä¸€å ´å……æ»¿å„ªé›…ã€æƒ…æ„Ÿèˆ‡ç„¡æ³•æŠ—æ‹’é­…åŠ›çš„éå‡¡é«”é©—ã€‚ Explore the Artistry of Musicians The Sirens emerged out of informal acoustic jams and late-night harmonising in the street after closing time to create a unique alternative folk sound. Made up of four Lamma women: Aleks (fiddle), Erin (guitar), Jeni (cello) and Lebo (cajon) re-interpret everything from traditional Irish to The Eurythmics, by way of Neil Young, Eva Cassidy, and Amy Winehouse. The Sirensâ€™ harmonies lean towards a mysterious, moody sound evocative of their mythological namesakes luring sailors lost at sea. Allure Music Salon: Evenings of Music and Mastery Allure Music Salon, nestled in Tai Hang's historic Century Stone House, Hong Kong, hosts enthralling musical evenings and workshops. Our Incubating series and Masters events spotlight emerging talents and seasoned maestros, fostering connections and inspiring audiences. Join us for a transformative experience where creativity shapes the future of music. title: Revamp x Dara: SIP N' SWAP Party
summary: Revamp invites you to it's 1st ever clothing swap party happening at Dara! Exchange your pre-loved items, enjoy drinks, music & good vibes!
venue: Dara, 189 Queen's Road West #Shop 3, 5-6, G/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: When & Where 19 July 2025, 11:30 am â€“ 5:30 pm Dara Shop 3,5-6, G/F, Soho 189, 189 Queenâ€™s Road West Sai Ying Pun Why Join? Revamp x Dara: SIP N' SWAP Party Get ready for the SIP N' SWAP Party hosted by Revamp at Dara! Join us on Saturday, 19th July 2025, and immerse yourself in a vibrant atmosphere celebrating sustainable living and conscious fashion. Exchange your pre-loved items and discover eco-friendly treasures while enjoying drinks, music and good vibes all around. Embrace a greener lifestyle by choosing secondhand. Sustainable Shop Alongside the clothing swap, we are excited to host a curated selection of clothes, bags and shoes for sale. All funds will go directly into enhancing Revamp's curated collections and future events. â€œHow To Swapâ€ Guide Swapping is an easy an enjoyable process - our 8 simple steps allow you to maximise each experience and successfully rotate their wardrobes with value for value. 1. PURCHASE your entry ticket online. Ticket priced at HKD100. Each ticket comes with one (1) FREE drink and one (1) raffle* entry. *Get a chance to win a HKD500 DARA dining voucher. 2. Clean your wardrobe and SELECT up to 10 items** to trade in - ALL Sizes, Shapes, Styles & Colours are encouraged. **If you would like to bring more than 10 items, these will be classfied as a donation and will not be eligable for additional swap credits. 3. Be sure to CHECK each item for defects. Items must meet our Exchange Eligibility standards to be accepted â€“ to ensure you maximise your swopping experience, please only bring along clothes that are in good condition, good enough to give to a friend. 4. Come along to our pop-up swap event and TRADE IN your items for swap credits. We will cross check your items upon arrival and you'll receive a wrist tag with the number of swap credits indicating how many items you can take. 1 item of clothing = 1 swap credit 5. SIP N' SWAP: Enjoy your spree! - our racks will be filled with other attendees pre-loved clothing. 6. We highly encourage you TRY on all the clothing before checking out. We want to ensure all items go to a home where they will be worn and enjoyed. 7. Once youâ€™re done looking through the racks and tried on your chosen items, CHECK-OUT your clothing in exchange for the number of credits you have. Any left-over credits will be converted into raffle draw entries. 8. Congratulations, you have now REVAMPed your wardrobe -- the sustainable way by choosing secondhand. Wear, enjoy and love your new (to you) clothes - Tag us in your swap finds @revamp.hongkong and see you at our next pop-up!

title: RICS Hong Kong Conference
summary: The Next Era of Hong Kong: Shaping a Resilient and Innovative Future
organizer: RICS Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors
venue: Hong Kong Ocean Park Marriott Hotel, 180 Wong Chuk Hang Road Aberdeen, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: In-person event 12th September 2025 09:00-17:00 HKT Hong Kongâ€™s property sector is undergoing a profound transformation amid shifting global economic conditions. As the industry grapples with uncertainty, opportunities arise for forward-thinking strategies that foster resilience and sustainable growth. The RICS Hong Kong Conference serves as a premier platform, bringing together influential stakeholders from government, industry, and academia. This forum will explore key developments in public-private partnerships, technological innovation, and sustainable financeâ€”critical drivers shaping the future of the built environment. Through insightful discussions and expert-led sessions, participants will gain valuable perspectives on emerging market trends, policy directions, and investment strategies that will define Hong Kongâ€™s competitiveness on the global stage. Attendees will engage in thought-provoking exchanges aimed at crafting a strategic blueprint for a more adaptive, efficient, and internationally integrated Hong Kong. By fostering collaboration and knowledge sharing, this conference will empower professionals to lead the next wave of transformation, ensuring a future-ready property market that meets the evolving demands of businesses, investors, and communities. Join us to be part of this essential dialogueâ€”where expertise meets vision, innovation drives progress, and new pathways emerge for Hong Kongâ€™s built environment. For more information, please visit our website.

description: WHERE & WHEN? Meet at The Station. Arrive any time, we start with a group warm-up at 7:30pm. HOW LONG IS THE RUN? title: Tai Po Kau Night Adventure
summary: Join us to take a look at the amazing nocturnal fauna in Tai Po Kau!
venue: Tai Po Kau Nature Reserve, Tai Po Kau, Tai Po, NT, Hong Kong, Tai Po, NT
description: Established in 1977, Tai Po Kau Nature Reserve is a land of 460 hectares, containing some of Hong Kongâ€™s most mature secondary forests along with many of Hong Kongâ€™s fauna. Nowadays, it has easily become one of the most popular and well-known wildlife spots, providing a safe haven for a plethora of wildlife species, such as migratory birds and Hong Kong warty newts during the winter months, as well as frogs and many different types of arthropods in the summer months. Regular sightings include Red Muntjac, a small and only member of the deer family in Hong Kong, along with East Asian Porcupines and Wild Boars, while certain amount of luck is required to encounter the elusive Leopard Cat. On this night tour, we will explore the lowest levels of this huge nature reserve, where we may see frogs near the ponds and rivers, moths fluttering about, insects resting on the plantation, and maybe even bats flying through the night sky. Tai Po Kau is also a well known location to see Fireflies, which breed from March to November, with breeding peaking between May to August. Dwarf Wood Scorpians are also common at Tai Po Kau, with the aid of UV lights we will be able to see these shy nocturnal creatures at their best, as their exoskeleten glows a bright cyan-green under UV lights. Join us as we explore the nocturnal fauna of Hong Kong Tour Fee: $330 for adults, $250 for children under 8 (minimum age is 3 years old) Meeting location: Tai Po Kau Nature reserve entrance (To get there by public transport, go to Tai Po Market MTR Exit A, take mini-bus 28k and ask to be dropped off at the "Tsung Tsai Yuen" bus station) Walking Distance: 5km Walk grade: Easy to moderate Terrain: Paved and nature paths, some steps Facilities: Toilets along route What to bring: Night torch or headlamps, bottle with drinking water, mosquito repellent Refund Policy â€¢ For a full refund, cancel at least 24 hours in advance of the start date of the experience. â€¢ The event will be fully refunded if tour is canceled due to yellow/red/black rain or thunderstorm warning .

title: Timfernal Affairs ft Tim Chan, Tim To, Tim Lam, and more!
summary: A special stand-up comedy showcase featuring Tim Chan, Tim To, Tim Lam, Caro Chan, Ha Chu, and Chris Musni!
venue: The Aftermath, 57-59 Wyndham Street, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Tim Chan is the main performer in stand up comedy group â€œHall of Laughs." Tim started his comedy career in 2011, winning the 2011 Hong Kong International Comedy Competition and has since sold out dozens of shows in Hong Kong and Australia. He has also performed in Mainland China, Macau, Taiwan, Malaysia, and Singapore. Tim is not only active in Hong Kong, he also performed in Mainland, Macau, Taiwan, Malaysia, Singapore & Australia. In 2017, Tim was invited by TEDxYOUTH to be a TEDx speaker. â€œTim's jokes sound like someone recalling a night out whilst it's still happening and somehow funnierâ€ - Ashley James Tim To is a Chinese Canadian comedian, he grew up in Toronto and has spent about a decade living in Hong Kong. His comedic style explores his unhinged interpretation of his experiences and defines his own brand of logic. In 2020, he was the winner of BushiRoast 4 and continues to explore his comedic style in shows throughout Hong Kong. Tim Lam is American Chinese and grew up in Singapore. Having originally worked in finance, he ended up in culinary school for a year, thus becoming the most disappointing Chinese first born son ever. He also showers regularly and lives with a cat. Caro Chan is a dynamic half-Chinese, half-African comedian based in Hong Kong, known for her unique perspective and vibrant stage presence. With a playful charm and a smile that lights up the room, Caro brings a wealth of storytelling and performance skills to her comedy. She made her stand-up debut in September 2023, quickly captivating audiences with her sharp wit and relatable humor. Caro's performances often explore themes of cultural identity and the nuances of life in a diverse city, making her a fresh voice in the Hong Kong comedy scene. Ha Chu is a stand up comedian from Hong Kong. His unique comedy style has brought him to stages across Asia, Australia and Europe. He is the first comedian from Asia to perform at the Christiania Comedy Club (Denmark). He was chosen by Melbourne International Comedy Festival to perform at the MICF- â€œComedy Zone Asiaâ€. He is a regular at the Hong Kong International Comedy Festival as well as the past winner of the Hong Kong International Comedy Competition. â€œOne of the most original comedians I have worked with. In my opinion, heâ€™s a must see comedian.â€ - Tom Cotter (USA) Chris Musni is a San Francisco native who moved to Hong Kong to achieve his lifelong dream of fame and fortune. Failing that, he took the stage and developed a witty comedic style that forces the audience to ask themselves questions such as â€œWhy are things the way they are?â€ or â€œWhen is this show going to end?â€ When not onstage you can find Chrisâ€™s big nose in a nonfiction book while thinking heâ€™s better than you or he might be shooting hoops with basketballs in Tseung Kwan O. "Very good." - Tom Arnold

title: TNN YOGA - relaxing stretch & sound healing
summary: Donation-based, gentle stretching yoga classes for body and mind brought to you by The New Normal Charity, Heinok Fan & friends.
organizer: The New Normal Charity Hong Kong
venue: The Yoga Lane, 27 High Street #B/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: The class will focus on holding yoga poses mindfully for 2-5 minutes to allow participants to stretch out tired muscles and find a space to relax and restore without the hustle and bustle of the city noise. This class will be complemented with sound healing to help with further relaxation. We hope to hold space for participants to embark on an inward experience to release stress and find ease in the body and the mind. Suitable for all levels, with modifications and variations offered to accommodate all participants. Bilingual instructions will also be on offer. We aim to make fitness for mental health accessible in Hong Kong. Thatâ€™s why we offer places in our classes for free for those experiencing financial hardship. Each TNN Yoga class costs $705HKD, $255 is an NGO discounted rental of the space and $450 goes to our amazing instructor(s) as we believe in fair pay. If you donate, you will be â€˜paying it forwardâ€™ and providing a space in our next yoga class for someone facing financial hardship. We want everyone to have access to the support they need, regardless of their identity or circumstance.Please note we will be hosting our classes at Yoga Lane STUDIO 2 unless otherwise stated.Schedule for this series: 29th May - Heinok & Valerie (sound healing) 5th June - Heinok & Mina (movement) 12th June - Heinok & Marcus (sound healing) 19th June - Heinok 26th June - Heinok & Christy (sound healing) 3rd July - Heinok & Terence (Wall rope special) 10th July - Heinok 17th July - Heinok Move Partners Taking part in physical activity can improve mental health in many ways; better sleep, happier moods, managing stress, anxiety, and intrusive thoughts, improved self-esteem, and connection to the community, to name a few. Move Partners is a collaborative project between The New Normal Charity and organisations, professionals, and athletes. We aim to reinforce the connection and the importance of moving to help support our mental health. The New Normal Charity The New Normal Charity is a Hong Kong registered S88 charity 91/19147. We offer free peer support groups for mental health. We aim to help and support one another through life's difficult moments. We want everyone to have access to the support they need, regardless of their identity or circumstance. We empower people with lived mental health experiences. We support people living in Hong Kong struggling to access the mental health support they need. Because no one should have to face mental pain alone. Heinok Heinok (she/her) is a yoga instructor, singing bowl sound healer and TNN HK volunteer. Sheâ€™s a RYT-200 yoga instructor with additional training in yin yoga, making yoga accessible and singing bowl sound healing level 1. As a healthcare professional who strongly believes in equality, she is passionate about wellness and accessibility concepts. Thus, you will find her teaching with a lot of anatomical cues and modifications as she leads you through her carefully curated functional flows. Tied with her passion for mental health empowerment and advocacy, her life goal of sharing with people that â€˜movement is a form of medicineâ€™.

title: UNHEARD 2025: BODY COUNT by Philipp Henkel
summary: BODY COUNT is a visceral and provocative exploration of the human form as both a site of trauma and resilience.
venue: Tomorrow Maybe, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road, Kowloon, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: BODY COUNT is a visceral and provocative exploration of the human form as both a site of trauma and resilience. Through a fusion of performance and mixed-media installation the piece interrogates the ways bodies are quantified, commodified, and politicizedâ€”whether in war, healthcare, or systemic violence. Drawing from inspiration: forensic anthropology, memorial archives and personal narratives, the work distorts and reconstructs the body, challenging viewers to confront the tension between individual identity and statistical anonymity. Fragmented, multiplied, or erased, the forms question: When does a body become a number? Who gets counted, and who remains invisible? With specific elements like repetitive silhouettes, raw data sonified and visualized, _Body Count_ oscillates between the intimate and the impersonal, urging a reckoning with the weight of collective loss and the fragility of corporeal existence. ________ Philipp Henkel is a German composer, curator, and multimedia artist based in Hannover. In his music, gestural instability and extended expressionism transform the subjective listening experience. His compositions and multimedia works explore the implications of technology and societal failure(s) through a research-led approach. In 2018 Henkel founded neuMERZ an interdisciplinary studio for research led art projects and curation in which he remains the artistic lead. Recent concerts and exhibitions of his work have taken place at GAIDA Festival in Lithuania, 21st Century Art Museum Kanazawa, Ryoguku Monten Hall Tokyo, Monopol Berlin, ZKM Karlsruhe.

title: UNHEARD 2025: Channelling Reduction by Simon Whetham
summary: â€œChannellingâ€ is a kinetic audiovisual project by Simon Whetham
venue: Tomorrow Maybe, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road, Kowloon, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: â€œChannellingâ€ is a kinetic audiovisual project, in which a collection of motor devices salvaged from obsolete and discarded consumer technology is reanimated by environmental sound recordings. In turn, this produces new sounds from the devices, which are amplifed using various microphones and techniques. The recordings feature seemingly mundane sound phenomena that occur unpredictably and irregularly in everyday life â€“ passing traffic, wind, doors closing â€“ and also sounds of other machines malfunctioning. Because of this, the movement of the devices is random, variable, and autonomous. This means the relationship between performer and devices is a collaboration rather than a master and servant type situation. â€œChannelling Reductionâ€ follows the trend of technology to miniaturise as it evolves, becoming smaller and lighter, but more powerful. Simon Whetham: Since 2005 Simon Whetham has worked with sonic activity as a material. He often uses environmental sound, employing a variety of methods and techniques in order to obtain often unnoticed and obscured sonic phenomena. He also explores ways of creating physical traces of sound and transforming energy forms. Whetham performs and exhibits internationally, has received a large number of commissions and awards, has many published composed works and regularly collaborates with other artists. His practice also covers giving active listening, field recording and technology repurposing workshops.

title: UNHEARD 2025: Roberto Maqueda -All the times I couldn't' say goodbye...
summary: All the times I couldnâ€™t say goodbyeâ€¦ is a deeply personal performance project by Roberto Maqueda.
venue: Terrible Baby, Music Room, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: All the times I couldnâ€™t say goodbyeâ€¦ is a deeply personal performance project by Roberto Maqueda that transforms unspoken farewells into sound. It explores the emotional landscape of relationships that faded without closureâ€”those moments suspended in silence and unresolved endings. Through four original compositions, the work navigates cycles of memory, doubt, and longing, while ultimately offering a fragile sense of hope. Premiered in ZÃ¼rich in 2025, the piece is an attempt to sonify the unsaid and give voice to what was left behind.

title: UNHEARD 2025: Searching Out, Saving, and Sounding Spaces
summary: This presentation introduces research into the spaces for sound art & experimental music as developed in the Chinese Mainland & HK.
venue: Terrible Baby, Music Room, 4/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: This presentation will introduce Edward Sanderson's research into the spaces for sound art and experimental music as they have developed in the Chinese Mainland and Hong Kong, and describe some of my recent activities based on this research. For the last 15 years or so he has focused on spaces for sound art and experimental music and spatially-related practices that find their homes in these spaces. Geographically, he restricts himself to the Chinese Mainland and Hong Kong (already a huge area), and the period is from the late 1990s to the present day, although he also deals with some earlier material for context. This research has led him to build up a physical archive of material, currently based in Hong Kong, and from this I have produced various texts, events, and curated exhibitions. This talk will be structured around four important stages in the development of this research: His PhD at HK Baptist University's Academy of Visual Art; the 2023 â€œSounds Like Printâ€ display at Tai Kwun Contemporary; the recently concluded exhibition â€œIt Always Sounds Somewhereâ€ at the Inside-Out Art Museum in Beijing; and the performance series â€œExit-Entryâ€ which invites Mainland artists to perform alongside local artists, and which serves as a further means to promote connections and knowledge sharing between the Chinese Mainland and Hong Kong. _______________ Bio: Dr. Edward Sanderson is a researcher and curator focusing on contemporary non-mainstream sonic practices from the Chinese Mainland and Hong Kong. In 2025 Edward curated the exhibition "It Always Sounds Somewhere" at Inside-Out Art Museum in Beijing, presenting an extensive set of installations of the multiple forms of space used for sound art and experimental music, supplemented by a series of related performances and talks. Edward is currently developing a physical and online archive of sound-related material, and co-curating the Exit-Entry performance series bringing together Chinese Mainland and local artists to play in Hong Kongâ€™s underground venues. title: UNHEARD 2025: Shared Frequencies: How to build community through radio
summary: A panel discussion w/ an assemble of community radios from Asia & Europe discussing the enduring medium of radio and how it builds community
venue: Kino, Eaton House (Co-working), 380 Nathan Road 1/F, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: A panel discussion with an assemble of community radios from Asia & Europe discussing the enduring medium of radio and the myriad ways in which it builds community. w/ Arthur Bray from FM Belowground (Hong Kong) Chris from Res Radio (Vienna) Dana from The Nifty Radio(Jakarta) James from Eaton Radio (Hong Kong) ___________________ FM Belowground: FM Belowground is a community radio station located in the basement of Landmark Building with a varied programme ranging from local dance and indie bands to podcasts to DJing workshops connecting people from different backgrounds and creative practices. Res Radio: Res.Radio is a non-commercial community webradio based in Vienna to strengthen and display subcultural genres. From its founding in 2019, the radio grew into a multicultural community/platform featuring artists with many different backgrounds. Within this platform people connect, exchange ideas and create content around music across all genres and talks, which addresses topics like contemporary culture, social injustice and other phenomena. Res.Radio is a space of diverse artistic freedom and is made from people for people. ___________________ The Nifty Radio: The Nifty Radio (Nifty) is an alternative music radio and archiving platform community-based in Bogor, notably in the electronic music scene. Providing a place for DJs, musicians, and music geeks from all over the world to promote, distribute, and create new connections, in line with the growth of the music ecosystem surrounds them. Presenting various types of music, and the sub-genres in it, also come with the artistic and visuals that represent the circumstances of the city. @mortarwithpestle / @theniftyradio ____________________ Eaton Radio: Eaton Radio empowers grassroots storytelling and supports emerging, contemporary, and historic underground music. Weâ€™ve produced over 2000+ shows of talk radio and music through a rich and varied rotation of DJ mixes, interviews, and regular shows.

title: UNHEARD 2025: Singing Bowl Session - Tuning the Mind, Healing the Body
summary: Shoji presents a singing bowl session for dogs and their owners. Shoji ç‚ºç‹—ç‹—åŠå…¶ä¸»äººå‘ˆç¾ä¸€å ´é Œç¼½éŸ³ç™‚ç´„æœƒã€‚

These bowls are played by striking or rubbing the rim with a mallet, creating harmonic sounds that promote relaxation and mindfulness. The sound waves produced can help to balance energy, reduce stress, and facilitate a meditative state. This ancient practice is rooted in various spiritual traditions and is gaining popularity in modern wellness for its ability to enhance emotional and physical well-being. - Calming Effect: The soothing tones of singing bowls can create a calming environment that helps reduce anxiety for both dogs and their owners, making it a perfect tool for relaxation. - Bonding Experience: Participating in sound healing sessions together can strengthen the bond between dogs and their owners, promoting feelings of safety and trust. - Stress Relief: Just as humans experience stress, pets can also feel anxious. The gentle sounds can help alleviate stress in dogs, making them more relaxed and at ease. - Enhanced Well-Being: Sound healing can promote physical and emotional well-being for both dogs and their masters, contributing to a healthier lifestyle and better quality of life. - Positive Environment: The vibrations and sounds can create a positive atmosphere that encourages playfulness and joy, benefiting the overall mood of the household. title: Women Changemakers Gathering in HK: Sound Healing & Creative Writing
summary: A gathering for women changemakers to rejuvenate creativity
venue: Dream Impact, Unit C, 4/F, 760 Cheung Sha Wan Road, Hong Kong, KOW, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: A safe place for women changemakers (and aspiring women changemakers) to meet one another; A small-scale gathering where you can actually have intentional conversations with everyone; A community you show up and participate equally as an agent of change; A space to exchange stories and find inspirations to bring collective impact; A tribe you can come back to as your support network and build intergenerational friendships. This is what this gathering is about. For women changemakers. On August 10 Sunday afternoon, Carmen Chan of Girls Be Change and Dorothy Lam of Dream Impact are going to team up with published writer Gillian Del Mundo and certified sound meditation healer Carol Lee, to have this special community gathering to connect changemaking, creative writing, and sound healing together. Let's explore our inner creativity and voice to lead change from within. It is a gathering where everyone shows up as an equal participant, questioning and chatting. No panel. No presentation. No speech. Just intentional conversations. Come join us on Aug 10 (Sun) for an afternoon to meet other fellow women changemakers and explore your creativity via soundhealing and writing! What is Women Changemakers Community Series? The idea began in the summer of 2023 when two changemakers in Hong Kong, Carmen (Girls Be Change) and Dorothy (Dream Impact), questioned and envisioned what an ideal community is. We need a safe place among women changemakers to have organic meetups, intentional conversations and idea exchange with social ease, find inspirations and encouragement from each other, and build authentic friendships and support networks. The first Women Changemakers Community Gathering was held in Hong Kong on March 8, 2024 at International Womenâ€™s Day. Ever since then, Girls Be Change cohosted with 20 (and counting) organizations and gathered over 150 (and counting) women changemakers in Hong Kong, Indonesia, Kenya, and Tanzania. With 15+ gatherings around the globe, a vibrant community of global women changemakers was formed and connected virtually to raise questions, exchange ideas, and celebrate wins. â€‹Co-organizers:

title: Xavier Vignon Wine Tasting
summary: Join us for a fun evening of tasting exquisite Xavier Vignon wines!
venue: Premier Cru, G/F 15 High Street, Sai Ying Pun, HKI, Hong Kong, Sai Ying Pun, HKI
description: Xavier Vignon Wine Tasting Join us for an exclusive evening dedicated to the exceptional wines of Xavier Vignon at Premier Cru. Experience a curated selection of five exquisite wines, personally presented by the knowledgeable representative. This in-person event offers an inviting atmosphere perfect for wine enthusiasts and newcomers alike. Donâ€™t miss this opportunity to savor some good French wines in a charming setting. Mark your calendars and prepare for a delightful evening of good wine and great company!

title: Yoga Class with Karen Chiang
summary: All are welcome to join our curated lineup of poolside yoga sessions. Whether you're looking to energise, deepen, or strengthen.
venue: 21/F Eaton HK, 380 Nathan Road Kowloon, Hong Kong, KOW 00000, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, KOW
description: Begin your Saturday with intention through a carefully crafted journey of movement and breath. These sessions have been thoughtfully curated by instructor Karen Chiang â€” from a more gentle session in the early morning, to a more energising and invigorating flow session, to a more focused and strength building session that combines yoga and pilates - there is something for all! 8:30 - 9:30am | MORNING FLOW Gently awaken your body and mind with our poolside Morning Flow--a nurturing Hatha yoga session perfect for beginners. This class invites you to restore balance through mindful, guided poses and breath awareness, helping you cultivate calm and clarity to carry with you throughout your day. 10:00 - 11:00am | INVIGORATING FLOW Energise your Saturday with Invigorating Flow, a thoughtfully paced mixed-level class centered around a monthly theme. This practice blends mindful movement, alignment-focused postures, and skill-building exercises designed to both challenge and soothe, leaving you feeling vibrant, grounded, and connected. Suitable for all levels. 11:30am - 12:30pm | YOGALATES FLOW Discover harmony in motion with Yogalates Flow--a mindful fusion of yoga and Pilates that strengthens your core, glutes, and spine mobility. This session deepens your mind-body connection through slow, controlled movements, helping you build strength, flexibility, and centeredness in a balanced, holistic practice. Venue: 21/F, Yoga and Fitness Room, Wellness, Eaton HK About Karen: I have been exploring fitness and well-being since 2015. Iâ€™m passionate about helping others fill their own cups and finding stillness in motion. My classes are challenging, but also joyful and calm. I teach uncomplicated sequences in a slow, alignment-based flow, always incorporating meditation and a savoured savasana. *Kindly ask a member of staff on the G/F to let you up to the 21/F upon arrival **Please arrive 10 min before class. Participants may not be allowed inside after the class has started in order to avoid distubances to other participants.

title: Yoga Therapy and Ayurveda Teacher Training Certificate Course
summary: Breaks: Easter - 31 Mar - 7 Apr 2026. Class Schedule:1st March 2026 - 5th July 2026, Sunday (10:00am - 1:00pm & 2:00pm - 5:00pm)
organizer: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the heart
venue: Anahata Yoga - Yoga from the Heart, Lyndhurst Terrace #Tower, 18/F, Hong Kong, HKI, Hong Kong, Hong Kong, HKI
description: Who we are Anahata Yoga is a premier yoga center based in the heart of the Central district. It is best known for offering the most authentic yoga experience available in Hong Kong, with classes led by Indian instructors hailing from different lineages devoted to the practice and study of yoga. As a center, Anahata Yoga is fully committed to fostering a community of yoga practitioners who are not only equipped with the skills to perform yoga as a daily activity, but as well as the knowledge to live out yoga as a lifestyle. Why us? We recognize that yoga is a popular pursuit in Hong Kong. People seek it out for its health benefits and often incorporate it into their active lifestyles. However, yoga instruction is not equal among the various yoga centers in Hong Kong. This is where our accredited Teacher Training Courses make all the difference. Our courses are accredited by, and offered in conjunction with, Asana Andiappan College of Yoga and Research Centre in India. This is the first time outside of India that such a program is being offered. Our classes are designed and taught in the same way as our instructors are taught. Predominantly from India, our instructors are fully learned not only in the practice of their discipline, but also in the history and philosophy behind the practice. The resulting combination of grassroots knowledge both practical and theoretical in our programs give students more in-depth learning than they may able to find elsewhere in Hong Kong.
